title: First usage of 'better' mouse
body: I wanted to title this "First usage of a high-end mouse", but at this price, it isn't really high-end, but it is a step up from the cheaper mice, and I wanted to see what it was like.I am impressed (mostly).It is a heavier mouse, but that makes it feel more solid, and I like that a lot. I also really, really noticed the very smooth gliding of the mouse, and like this a lot.I don't do head-to-head gaming; most of my games are solo playing. I don't really see much of a difference with this mouse over the old mice.I'm really used to 3-button mouse, so I really don't know what to use the two extra mouse buttons for (they are on the left side of the mouse, and they won't be accidentally clicked as long as the grip stays in the lower area. I looked up some suggestions, but I was a bit disappointed that some key combinations don't work (I was hoping to map ctrl+windows+left to one button and ctrl+windows+right to the other, but it doesn't seem to realize when I press the windows button).That brings us to the software.. you have to install it to adjust the lights or assign the buttons. The EULA basically says that they collect data on usage. I did want the lights to turn off after a time, and I like the "breathing" light... so, for now, I'm running it (the effects don't stick when you don't run the program). I don't trust the software that comes with the mouse. There may be some other way to control it.Aside from the software, I'm impressed by my foray into fancier mice.

title: Comfy mouse, but scroll press is weird

The only complaint I have is that when I use scroll up and down (I use a lot in gaming) it mistakes it as scroll press way too easily, my old mouse wasn’t like that. If I scroll up just a little too much it will activate the scroll press in my games (which is usually ping) and it’s annoying. Other than that the mouse is pretty looking

title: This mouse is perfect for your gaming needs!

This mouse is so easy to use the buttons on the side are perfect for gaming keybinds, the clicking is so smooth and easy, and the DPI is perfect and adjustable! You can set the RGB to different settings such as solid color or breathing and more! I absolutely love this mouse and definitely would recommend it to everyone!

title: Great mouse for the value.
body: I needed a high quality laser mouse. I play FPS games. Not "professionally" and I don't even intend to try. I imagine there is a need for very advanced mice. So if that is you, maybe check reviews by people who intend to game+stream for a living to ensure you are getting the really in-depth look and the best information. If you need durable laser mouse and enjoy games, and are trying to find that sweet spot between buying quality and not breaking the bank, I think this is your mouse. I probably got it on sale, but my Logitech M500s broke a second time (RIP good buddy) I decided I would just try a new mouse. That Logitech was basically everything I needed and wanted in a mouse but I figure Razer made nice stuff and I wanted to try a simple corded mouse with a few extra buttons. This was everything I needed and more. It has 1) a light on it and 2) some software to install. I didn't really want to but I installed it. I think you have to register. I did. It wasn't a pain but it's a mouse. You should plug it in and use it and that's it. The bad thing is the light. It's a green light and bright. That's completely unnecessary. You can easily turn it off with the software you install and I did. Beyond that, I have everything I need. It feels great in the hand. The additional buttons are in sensible places and that helps with games. The scroll-wheel is just fine. Great mouse! Turn the light off and it is even better.

title: Let me tell you why the other reviews on here are WRONG
body: 1. This mouse is not "lightweight junk".2. Braided cables are worse.3. Silicone side grips were never that great.Some of the reviews on here are ridiculous. Let me clear some things up.The Kailh switches in here are mid-weight and feel slightly heavier (and less mushy) than the optical switches in the Deathadder V2. The side buttons feel significantly better than the V2. The scroll wheel is less tactile (or smoother, depending on how you look at it).This is a heavy, heavy boy by today's standards. This thing is better built than the V2, but consequently harder to do a weight reduction mod because the plastic is so damn thick.People that complain about this version not having a braided cable... you want an even less flexible one?! Razer's braided cable is the same rubber cable with an additional outside sheath, making it even less flexible. This cable is an improvement from years past, but it's not great. Fortunately because it's not braided, it's easy to rip the rubber sheath and shielding off, and paracord it.The side grips are meh. It's a bit more than molded plastic, but not as noticeable as the silicone on the V2. Silicone still gets slippery when wet, so best solution was always aftermarket grips. If the V2 had G703 quality rubber grips to being with, then I could see the grip complaints on here being justified.My biggest problem with this thing is the lack of replacement skates. No corepads or tiger ice for this model. It has the rear skate of the V2, but two front skates more similar to the V2 Pro. If you you like the white color or mechanical switches, and use less than 6400dpi, then can't go wrong for $20 and some elbow grease.Software still blows. Can use open source software to permaset light effects when not plugged into PC w/ Synapse.

title: Not Quite the Thing I Needed
body: The good news is that the product is sleek, tracks well, and has great ergonomics. I would rate it a genuinely great buy except that the left-side, rearward (away from the cable) button does not work. Hmm, I thought maybe it needs programming, so I downloaded the app. A bit clunky, it recognized the button being pushed, but offered no way to switch its function with a working button. Clearly from the software, it is not defective, it is just unrecognized. I did some online searches only to find this is a very common problem with this mouse - button 4 does not work. The suggestions were the usual, unplug and replug - to no avail. Tried on a different machine, still not recognized.If you do not need that particular button, treat this as a 5/5 review. If you do, there really seems to be no guarantee you can make that button work. Caveat: this is on a high-end Windows gaming PC - your mileage may vary on some other platform.

title: Perfect for dogs and fetch, probably not for tennis

Since these balls bounce poorly and are misshapen, I don’t feel it would be conducive to playing tennis. But for indoor fetch with my labradoodle, they are absolutely perfect. I plop them all in a basket and my pup picks them all out and brings them to the closest human for a riveting game of indoor fetch. I have these set on a six-month recurring delivery so by the time I am down to only a ball or two, which seems perfect for our needs. If you want to play outdoor fetch, I would recommend a 3-pack of name brand tennis balls to have on hand as well.

title: Not durable. Pressurized for no reason.
body: I have a 36 pound border collie, which is quite literally a tennis ball fetching addict! I bought these for him. They only last 2 times It fetching (1hr-2hr) at most. At the least, they have lasted about 45 minutes. My dog does not chew on them,, he is not one of the dogs who’s goal is to destroy them! The only thing he does besides fetch them, is bite down on them repeatedly as if he were trying to make it squeak. The only time he does this is while he is being the ball back after after i throw it. I am no idea why these balls are pressurized they shouldn’t be because they’re 2/2 they’re made from chew rubber halves, that aren’t even still together very well. If they were still together very well my 36 pound border collie would not be able to bite down on them. He was done over and over while bring in the bathroom looks like he’s kind of chewing gum are trying to squeak them. I swear yesterday one of these balls just slash and 2/2 just covered by the felt after only 6 throws. I have no idea what they’d be like for tennis but I have a feeling they do the same thing! I buy tennis balls, because my dog prefers them, so much that he won’t play with another type of ball!! I try ( i am buying real ones ) to buy real, pressurized, tennis balls, instead of the ones that they specifically make for dogs.I do so because, they are not made if 2 halves glued together (which always eventually come apart) , and because the pressurized ball bounce incredibly well . Even after they loose pressure they still bounce better than n the balls made from 2 halves, and most definitely these balls, which are pressurized, but quickly loose pressure after the halves start to detach. Another thing i take issues with, is that these “pressurized bells come in a box, so they are not fully pressurized when they are received. Pressurized tennis balls should be stored in a container which is designed to maintain the pressure of the balls . Like the container which holds 3 at a time, the balls are not subject to pressure change until the pressure in the container, becomes less than that inside each of the balls. I would gave given 2 stars , if not for this hypocrisy.

title: They bounce
body: I asked my son what he wanted for his 8th grade graduation. He says, “oh I don’t know. Maybe just a few tennis balls”. I was thinking I’d be buying some Xbox or PlayStation crap so if my kid decides he wants “a few tennis balls”, I’m going nuts!So naturally I ordered him a crap ton of these. Now I’m not really a pro tennis player. Actually I’ve only played real tennis twice in high school and then decided that was enough so I don’t know how to accurately judge a quality tennis ball. But my kid was excited as hell. They bounce. Dogs have chewed them and they didn’t tear apart right away and they launch off a baseball bat. So I’m going with these being some A+ tennis balls.

body: I agree with other reviewers that these do not look like good balls to play tennis. However, I bought these to bring to the dog park and throw to my ball obsessed Golden Retriever. I am lucky he does not have any interest in destroying them, just chasing, retrieving and carrying around. As balls seem to disappear quickly at the dog park (taken by other dogs, not seen where thrown or dropped and lost when distracted) having value priced balls is the key for me.One thing to be aware of. If you use a Chuck-it like I do, these balls seem to be ever so minutely smaller than the “real” tennis balls, so they have a slightly different release point.

title: Inexpensive, high visibility balls
body: I needed something soft to put over some protruding bolts on the bottom of an overhead storage area shelf that I did not feel were practical to cut off, but which might cause injury if anyone were to climb into or under the shelf area. The bolts had an off thread that I could not find acorn nuts for, so I thought about foam balls, tennis balls, etc. I settled on these because they are not 'serious' tennis balls, not really being intended for actual play (they are advertised for 'training'), but because the price was fairly low, they are bright yellow, and they are the correct size for my application. I planned to drill, or poke, a small hole in each ball, inject some Great Stuff expanding foam, then jam the ball over the protruding nut (into the hole that I made), and when the injected foam hardens, it should form around the bolt threads and hold the balls onto the bolts pretty well, yet I could still remove the balls easily enough if necessary later on. The high visibility yellow would warn people, and the large soft balls would not cause injury.I have seen some other people's reviews that these balls were not very durable when used as toys for their dogs, and I cannot comment on that. However I did notice that these balls have a visible raised seam under the fuzzy coating, probably due to sloppy molding of the rubber sphere underneath. So, I would agree with others that these are not the highest quality tennis balls. Still, good enough for my odd application.

title: No case, just loose balls
body: I have never before gotten tennis balls not in a can, so I do not know if this is standard, but they seemed to lack bounce. I will continue to use them when I go practice against a wall but I will not buy again.

title: Want Slow But Unpredictable? Ask for Kevenz!
body: These are shipped in a box. No can. Not pressurized. That's because they come flat. Most of them are pretty round, but a few had a lip on the seam of the ball which could be fun if you put a fierce spin on them. My wife and I had fun making fun of how bad these tennis balls are. They'd be good for dog fetching / dog toys, or juggling. But for tennis? Even with raw beginners? Not so much.Update a month later--- these are just really bad.

If you want a durable ball for your dog, it’s probably most worth your money to pay the extra little amount for Penn or Wilson balls.

title: Good value basic saucepans
body: I've been replacing a lot of worn out cookware in the last year and I specifically needed one and two quart saucepans and it was very difficult to find them. Apparently those are not common sizes and even looking for them in open stock was not resulting in anything I liked. I am very pleased with these as they are kind of a universal basic black simple design. I measured their content capacity because some of the other reviewers thought they may not be as big as they claim to be but they are. The nonstick seems quite solid. The handles are very sturdy and they are heat safe so that you will be able to put your hand on them without using a hot pad which is important to me; I dislike sauce pans that have metal handles that require you to get out a hot pad every time cuz I always forget. One thing someone commented about was that the handle is heavy enough that the one quart saucepan over balances on the stove and that is true but it has been true of every one quart saucepan I've ever had because if the handle is sturdy it's just going to be that heavy. Now if you have an induction cook surface I believe there may be a problem with the two quart. The one quart seems to have a solid bottom but the two quart has little metal circle inserts, and if the structure is what I think it is, only those little circles will be triggered by the induction cooktop. That means if you're trying to saute something in it, only those exact spots will get hot though if you are warming a liquid it will be okay. I've included a photo of the two different bottoms in my review for your reference.

title: Great product for the price!!
body: The Goods:Accurate and easy-to-use: The digital display is easy to read and the scale is accurate to 0.05lb/0.02kg, making it perfect for tracking changes in weight and body fat. The Bluetooth connectivity feature allows me to sync my data to the Etekcity app, making it easy to track my progress and set goals. The app is user-friendly and provides detailed insights into my body composition, including muscle mass and BMI.Slim and Sleek Design: The scale is well-constructed and can support up to 400lb. Its slim and sleek design makes it easy to store in my bathroom and its automatic on/off feature helps save battery life.Strongly Recommended: Overall, I would highly recommend the Etekcity Smart Scale to anyone who wants to track their body composition and monitor their progress over time. It's an excellent product that is accurate, easy to use, and packed with features.The Bads:Inaccurate on Soft Surfaces: It should definitely be used on a hard surface, as even our very low-pile carpeting altered the results.Careful Placement: When you step on the scale, don't step on the edge instead of on the metal contact points or the scale will flip up on you.Connectivity Issues: Once it was connected, it is easy to use and keep track of the results, but connecting with my smartphone was not that straightforward, and I had to read the instructions carefully. I would make sure that you have Bluetooth turned on before you get on the scale so you can have it record your results.

title: Love this bathroom scale

I also love the features on this scale, I haven't used all the features yet but only had the scale a few days. My husband passed away a couple of months ago and I haven't been eating much. I decided I needed to check my weight as I can't afford to lose weight. My scales weren't giving me a good reading, kept fluctuating. So got this scale. Easy to set up and pair with my cellphone. So much information with the reading. I make sure to weigh myself at the same time every morning. I highly recommend this scale. You can set it for multiple users so the family can keep track of their individual weights. It's very accurate, and easy to read the results.

title: Great Purchase
body: I have had one other digital scale that was a poor investment mainly because it quit working to soon. I went back to the old style scales that required a continues zero reset for accurate weights. I came back to the digital scales with my purchase of this Elekcity Smart Scale and all I can say is there is a tremendous improvement over what was available before and this scale has provided information that if needed I can present it to a doctor via my phone app. There is no longer a need to reset my scale each time I use it and for me as a senior citizen is a big relief not having to bend over all the time. Additionally, it looks good in our bathroom. If you are truly looking for a dependable scale this is one I can recommend you purchase.

Also tracks other measurements such as hydration, BMI, etc. I think these measurements are using algorithms but still probably roughly accurate, so useful.The only problem I've had is that when the scale turns on, it doesn't immediately connect to Bluetooth and my app. I have to step on the scale a couple times for it to connect. Other than that, I'm very happy with this purchase.

The app is user-friendly and provides detailed insights into my body composition, including muscle mass and BMI.The scale is well-constructed and can support up to 400lb. Its slim and sleek design makes it easy to store in my bathroom and its automatic on/off feature helps save battery life.Overall, I am extremely satisfied with my purchase of the Etekcity Smart Scale and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for an accurate and easy-to-use body scale.

title: Not when it’s cold
body: I got this scale 3 weeks ago. It was easy to set up and I’ve had fun seeing all the data provided for both my husband and myself. After 2 weeks it stopped recording anything but weight first thing in the morning. I read the trouble shooting tips provided in the app and followed the instructions. Still no. I contacted support through the app and told them the steps I’d taken. They replied within 12 hours with a worthless answer telling me to do all the things I had already told them I had done.Then I figured it out. We have had a cold snap this week and the bathroom has been in the mid 50’s in the mornings. The sensors won’t read when that cold. The scale continued to work fine later in the day but not first thing. If I stand on the scale and warm up the sensors for a minute or two then step off and reweigh myself it will take all readings. My feet, fresh from an electric blanket cocoon, are warm enough to heat the sensors.Crazy but true.

title: Does what it is supposed to do
body: It is a nice looking, easy to move around scale that does more than I need it to. It should definitely be used on a hard surface, as even our very low-pile carpeting altered the results. When you step on the scale, don't do what I did the first time and step on the edge instead of on the metal contact points or the scale will flip up on you. That is NOT the scales fault - that was me being a doofus!It was easy to connect with my smartphone, but I would definitely read the instructions carefully. Once it was connected it is easy to use and keep track of the results. I would make sure if you are connecting to your smartphone that you have Bluetooth turned on before you get on the scale so you can have it record your results.Another thing I like about this scale is that the readout is easy to see and I don't have great eyesight so that is a major plus. Also, the scale is low enough that I can open and close the bathroom door without it hitting the scale. Your results may vary.

title: Perfect scale
body: Would repurchase as a gift. I haven’t checked out all the awesome phone connection pluses it has yet.Just giving pointers for weighing yourself on a scale1-Go to CVS or Walgreens or the doctors office to get weighed. Then go home and weigh yourself. This way, you know your weight is correct.2- When you wake up in the morning, go to the bathroom first, then weigh yourself before you drink or eat.3- NEVER weigh yourself throughout the day!!!! You will gain weight within the day that you will lose by morning (water weight)Some people weigh in daily and some weekly. Choose what is best for you. I personally prefer to weigh in daily. This way can check myself if I see it going in the wrong direction.Good luck

title: The scale is not accurate
body: Initially, I was excited to use this scale because of the added measurements but it turns out, those measurements are not accurate. The measurement that is accurate is the mass itself (your body weight and BMI). The water measurement, visceral fat, muscle, protein, etc are all BS. If you want a real assessment of your metrics, go with another scale. These metrics are based on collected data received from people in a similar weight category. SMH.Example: I measured myself Day 1 and it happened to be during the end of my time of month. I weighed in at 181 pounds. BMI 30.5. Visceral fat 13. Body fat 36.1. Muscle mass 109.2.On Day 2: Weight 178.4 pounds. BMI 29.7. Body fat 35.2. Visceral fat 12. Muscle mass 108.6.On Day 3: weight 177.0 pounds. BMI 29.5. Body fat 34.9%. Visceral fat 12. Muscle mass 108.3.Skip to day 11: weight 176.5 pounds. BMI 29.4. Body fat 34.7%. Visceral fat 12. Muscle mass 108.4.Today Day 13: weight 179.7 pounds. BMI 29.9. Body fat 35.5%. Visceral fat 12. Muscle mass 109.1.For reference: my body measurements are: day 1: Bust- 38.5” DDWaist: 31”Hips: 46”Reference 2: I put on 20 pounds in the last two years. My normal measurements are Bust 34” DD, waist 26”, hips 42”Reference 3: day 13 body measurements: Bust 40” DD, waist 33”, hips 46” (measurements have gone up because I turn into a bloated lolly pop during PMS time) plus I have more muscle on my abs. Sidenote: your waist will grow slightly thicker when building muscle UNTIL you get off the extra fat and focus on cardio. I shared these measurements so that you can see, hopefully, the correlation between the scale measurements for day 13. My body expanded from water wait and it’s why the scale read a higher mass. The discrepancy lies in the body fat- I did not gain body fat in the last two weeks but the scale is saying otherwise because again, it is an average reading of people in a similar age, gender, and body weight! Look at day 11 and 13. The measurements tell me my body fat increased. This is inaccurate for two reasons: 1) I’ve increased my physical activity while I’ve cut calories and 2) I have gained water weight since it’s coming close to my cycle (NOT FAT).Now, compare my Day 1 measurements to Day 13. I call BS on this scale because my muscle mass did not go down and then suddenly back up to where it was 2 weeks prior. The difference is my diet! I’ve fluctuated between high and low carbs every few days. That’s the only difference and I’m still working out regularly. Secondly, my goal is to lose body fat and I’ve been in the gym focusing on weights to build muscle. My diet has been CLEAN and in a caloric deficit with one cheat meal a week. I eat Plantbased and have also cut sugar out and processed foods almost completely. I don’t eat processed food daily and I’ve been focusing on a large quantity of veggies and fresh fruit with each meal and snack. Also, I know for a fact I’ve gained muscle mass ( beyond what this scale is saying) because my thighs are noticeably thicker and I have more muscle on my upper arms ( triceps, deltoids, traps). Thirdly, notice how the measurements increase with an increase in body mass and how they decrease with a decrease in body mass.So again, I call BS. If you want real measurements, not just something to make you feel good and tingly inside, find another scale. If you’re only going for your body mass, this is a good scale.Just FYI- some of the days I am eating low carbs which will cause the scale to drop drastically. On the days I eat high carbs ( bread, rice), the scale is higher the very next morning. Why? Carbohydrates bond to water molecules which cause an increase in water!If I am wrong, I will come back and update this post. I will still update periodically. Hope this helps.

title: Nice scale, most of the time
body: This scale is great, when it works. It's suppose to show you not only your weight but, your muscle mass, water weight and several other things. Most of the time, it's only showing me my weight and BMI. I constantly have to sync it back to my watch and Bluetooth. When it works, it's great but when it doesn't, it's disappointing.

title: Lotta fun
body: My holiday figure isn't what I want in the new year, so I've purchased this scale to keep track of my weight and body fat. There is a downloadable program that reads many data points relating to weight and body fat. I did some research to see if all this information was actually producable with this scale and found that it is! The price was very affordable. The unit is quite attractive. The data provide to the phone app is plotted and can be followed easily as you work towards you goals. If all you want is your weight, its as easy as any floor scale. If you want more and you have a smart phone, it can be quite informative.

title: DURABLE AF
body: I saw so many reviews saying this breaks easily, but I have had this for months and I have bumped and dropped and hit this thing so many times and it has survived everything I threw at it. And the app works great. And it is accurate.

title: Smart
body: I love it

title: Weigh in
body: Replaced an old scale and found out it was off. App tracks my weight loss. Easy enough!

title: Great Scale
body: Nice looking, precisely accurate weight, app is easy to use if you choose to use it. Nice looking and easy to use. Happy with this purchase and more than worth the price.

title: Works but short battery life
body: It’s a fine scale, works like it says. Knocked a star down cause it drained the battery in a very short/quick time frame. Way quicker than it should have

title: good scales but....
body: It connected to my phone the first time I stepped on them and hasn't done right since.will recorded my weight but the rest of the stuff won't record.

title: The scale
body: I like the app link and overall information you garner from the scale.

title: Justo lo q nececitaba
body: Me gusta q se queda guardado la ultima vez q me pese en el app, aun no lo haya abierto! Muy acertado el peso!

title: Worked as advertised.
body: Very Accurate. Repeats readings.

title: Great product
body: Easy to set up

title: Worth The Price-Point; Pros and Cons
body: So this is actually a review including 2 bottles, as I recently bought one to replace the first one I had (first pic/blue-pink bottle) and haven't used the new one (Opal) yet. So functionality review will be based around my experience with my first.For the sake of those looking for a quick answer; I find the product to be worth the price-point. I also believe in getting what you pay for. I had my bottle for around a year (only tossed-out due to my own folly) and it did everything I wanted out of a bottle.Cons:- There was a bit of a weird, chemically smell/taste like others have mentioned. I did get it to go away; cannot say if others could as well.- You run a small-risk of getting a pre-dented bottle? Amazon makes it pretty easy to exchange (for me).-A little difficult to get the gasket in and out, so you can really make sure you don't have any bacteria growth in your lid.- Supposedly "not actually vacuum-insulated". **This is based on responses within other comments.Pros:- Absolutely keeps your drinks cold. Even if you just put the drink in cold, with no additonal ice.- At least sturdy enough to only get a little scuffed-up when it falls to the asphalt from the top of your car and no safety-bands on it.- Good for a long time, as long you don't heck up and let it get gross by accident. And you may even just be more confident in your sanitizing abilities than I am.As I mentioned above; I got my first bottle (blue/pink) about a year ago. I only replaced it because of my own mess-up, where I left Liquid IV I was drinking-on in it for waayy too long (I am ADHD and object permanency/executive dysfunction is a constant struggle) and I was not going to try and believe I could clean it thoroughly enouch, especially since the bacteria had gotten under the gasket as well (the thin, opaque, silicone-ring in your lid that creates the seal. The ring is removable (need something to pry it out), however that's a tight spot and didn't think I could scrub into it enough and feel safe.I don't believe my first bottle came with the additional 2-lids, so that was a nice surprise this-time-around, to have some options.I won't even really touch on the "is it actually vacuum-insulated or not" convo because, as much as I have a vague-knowledge about vacuum-spaces and the science to that.. I have the ability to admit I know nothing about how that applies to water-bottles enough to make some of the statements others have in their reviews. The Company seems adamant in that they are.. and if they have a step within their manufacturing process that involves attempting to create some kind of a vacuum-layer? Then I'm not going to sit here and try to call them liars, just because it doesn't seem to fit an ideal of what that should look like. 🤷🏼‍♀️Does it keep your stuff cold?? Yeah, 100%. I have put just refrigerated water, with no ice, and it's stayed cold for hours. Then it's even colder/longer with ice. I did get the weird, chemically smell/taste that others have mentioned. But I just used a straw-cleaning brush to get into the drinking-nozzle and crevices of the lid with some Dawn and really hot water and it was gone.There were a few, good drops that had happened and it barely dented, really even barely scuffed, which was impressive.. until.. lolWe come to the original order of the replacement bottle (Opal). Now, I was able to immediately order a replacement (that is 100% fine) and am sending this one back.. however, I am just incredibly curious what in the WORLD happened to it, more than anything?? Lol My old-bottle had never exactly fallen at 50mph onto a curb or anything like that.... But if the bottle in the 2nd pic is any indication to the possible results, I don't recommend being that rough with it. Lol the Amazon bag did not have any damage that correlated to the damage on the box/bottle, so I'm assuming it had already happened before being packaged for shipping to me. With how hard Amazon employees work, I don't really blame them for missing it (or not caring if they did see it lol).If you're looking for a water-bottle that functions and you don't mind the possibility of needing to exchange a faulty one and giving it a GOOD scrub before-use (really should be, anyways)? This is a great choice at a more humble price-point, compared to other brands whose products don't function much, if any better than this one would for you.

title: Top Notch!
body: I have been suing my 32oz Iron Flask for well over a year. I used it EVERY day. Its on my desk at work, on the table at home, next to me in my car. I always keep a cold drink of water by my side in my Iron Flask. I can fill it with ice and water before I leave work friday and Monday morning when I roll into work I dump a little bit of ice out (assuming I dont refill the water along the way), wash and refill. Absolute beast when it comes to keeping ice and cold water.Its been durable as well. The color has a couple scratches to metal from dropping in on the ground. However, no dents. I use the flip open straw top exclusively and it was fine til i dropped it when open and it landed on that. It still works, but is a little wonky now (as in it has to be slightly pulled to the side to seal completely).I have never used it for hot drinks so I honestly dont know how it is for hot stuff, but thats not what I bought it for. I bought it specific for ice water at work. Its way to good to keep it on my desk alone so it travels with me. Zero complaints. Would buy then for family and my self again.

title: Just what I wanted! Love it!
body: I drink tons of water and my previous water bottle while I like it I didn’t love it. I LOVE this bottle! It’s the 40 oz in peach. 1. Bigger than most water bottles without being awkward and enormous. 2. The peach is a beautiful color, I would call it more salmon or coral though than peach, but that’s what I wanted was coral so I’m happy. 3. My previous bottle drove me crazy because it was also metal and so LOUD! The handle is not one that swivels so it can’t hit the side and clang. Also when you drink (with the straw) it’s silent not a slurping noise. I bought the iron flask boot as well so the bottom doesn’t clang when you sit it down either. 4. Yesterday it was close to 80 degrees and it sat outside all day with me and the original ice still in it. It really does keep it cold! I’m not sure about hot because I don’t plan on using it for hot.Only con, which is not really a con, but I added the boot and paracord handle. I wish at least the boot came with it, you really do need it to protect the powder coating and noise reduction.

title: Wonderful water bottle
body: I absolutely love this water bottle! The large size is perfect for my needs and lasts all day. The sturdy metal design is impressive and can withstand dents without any issues. I also appreciate the multiple tops that come with it, which can be customized for any type of drink, including hot coffee or cold water. The bottle does an excellent job of keeping my water cold throughout the day, which is a huge plus.One thing that really stands out to me is that the bottle does not leak, no matter how much I turn it upside down or drop it. The water tight lid is really effective, which gives me peace of mind knowing that I won't accidentally spill my drink. Additionally, cleaning the bottle is a breeze, and there's no chance for mold to grow.Lastly, the mint green color is beautiful and gets me lots of compliments wherever I go. Overall, I'm extremely pleased with this purchase and would definitely recommend it to others who are looking for a high-quality, reliable water bottle.

title: Very good
body: I use this to keep water nearby me at all times, at home or at school. I love to drink water, especially cold water, and this flask does a great job at keeping water cold. I love the white with the light colorful marbling, it is easy on the eyes and I'm glad I went with it over one of the blue designs (I like blue too so they were also heavily considered when I was choosing a color). I've also stuck some stickers on mine recently and the design doesn't draw attention away from them.It is kind of wide, so I don't think it will fit in the average cupholder. I'm not personally concerned about this, so it isn't a deal breaker for me. I actually like the size of it a lot, I feel like it holds a decent amount of ice and water, and even though I drink from it often I don't have to fill it every time after I take a drink.I think if you're looking for a reliable water bottle, this is a good choice.

title: Life Changing (Hear me out)
body: This bottle is the one I've been looking for for soo long! Heads up, this is going to sound like a shill but its just that good IMO.Multiple lids - Amazing and such a nice convenience. Having the multiple lids have allowed me to use this for 90% of what I drink from now.Materials used - Soda safe! Soda always has a bad flavor from metal thurmice/cups but this one, I can safely say it works. Just be careful with which lid you use for this as carbonation could create a small explosion/leaking.Not a single drop has leaked from this bottle since I got it, 2-3 weeks IIRCThis bottle has allowed me to stop buying other bottles and actually drink water much easier (Your results may vary)Ive tried off-brand, cheap, expensive, Yeti tumblers, this one seals the deal for me. Insulation is decent, but dont take my word for that one. I am also not a coffee person, so do your research if you are that type of person. 4/5 stars only because cleaning can be a challenge with the lids.Got extra straw and a sticker with my purchase :) I can't be happier realistically.

title: INCREDIBLY INSULATED
body: I typically use this for drinking water, so I know how well it keeps water cold all day. I did not, however, just how amazing the insulation is for hot liquid as well. I got new piercings so I whipped up a sterile saline solution just to have available to soak the piercing. I made it in the bottle by putting salt and pouring boiling water in. Then I put on the lid and put it in the fridge to use later. I figured I’d chill it so that if I want to use cold (for soothing or whatever) or warm I could heat some up in the microwave. ANYWAY…this was a day and a half before I used it for the first time. I went to pour some into a cup to heat up and soak my ear….but it was STILL BATHTUB HOT. Like….not warm. HOT. In the fridge for a day and a half. I am so impressed!

title: The straw makes it easier to drink water discreetly
body: I purchased the peach colored Iron Flask bottle (18 oz.) and I love it. My size fits in a cup holder according to the description of the product . The design is sleek, beautiful, and the color shade is the same color as seen in the product's photos. My Iron Flask water bottle arrived on time and before I used it, I cleaned all the parts (including the bottle). It's like 3 bottles in one with the multiple lid options. This is an impressive water bottle and since it is designed well it should last a very long time. Definitely worth the investment. I love that this company have many colors available to personalize your bottle. In addition, my water stays cold for at least 8+ hours and the straw is easy to sip from. Love it!

title: Cat & Elbow-proof
body: I have six foot long elbows and cats who own every countertop in my home.As a result, this incredible water bottle has withstood some heavy hits and falls. Yet, it has never dented. The vacuum seal is still intact, still looks brand new.The exterior coloring has not yet scratched off after over a year of regular use, even on the bottom.The interior steel seems to be high quality, it "sings" when rubbed and has a rainbow sheen.I also have two of the wide mouth soup/food mugs, and they have the same durability.As a clumsy person who owns almost nothing without dents or damage, I highly recommend iron flask.

title: The bottle is great, but the lids are very basic
body: I have been using a couple of Contigo water bottles for the past few years (a 24 oz. and 32 oz. Ashland Autospout), and I really liked them. However, they are not insulated, so will collect condensation on them when filled with ice water. I decided to get the Iron Flask because I know somebody who has one and likes it. I purchased the 40 oz. black bottle.I can fill this bottle with ice and cover the ice in water, and the ice will still be there 8-9 hours later, but only if you're not drinking out of it (I left ice water in it over night just as a test). If you are drinking from it occasionally, the ice is more likely to melt a little faster. Condensation has never formed on the outside of the bottle. The wide mouth is pretty much par-for-the-course for metal bottles; my Contigo tops actually fit well on this bottle. My MSR MiniWorks EX is a little more of a snug fit, but it still fits enough that I feel confident that I could use the two in concert to procure water outdoors. I have also purchased the Iron Flask paracord handle, which makes the bottle easier to carry. I do see some room for improvement, though not with the bottle itself, which has been working out great so far. My complaints are mostly with the straw/spout lid (which is the only one I use), and most of those I only really have because I am comparing it to my Contigo lids.The old Contigo Autospout lids were better in almost every respect; they had a lower profile, they were more watertight, they had a more rigid straw, and you could operate them with one hand. The Iron Flask lid often has to be set on a surface to be opened with one hand. Having a springy spout with a button-operated catch is a much easier and more convenient system to use one-handed. The loop on the spout lid is also just about perpendicular to the long axis of the bottle, which makes carrying it in hand or attaching it to a backpack a little more cumbersome than a design with an more steeply angled loop. As mentioned above, I purchased the paracord handle, and that makes this bottle significantly more convenient. The air inlet on the lid is plugged by a small post that is molded into the drinking spout. This is enough to keep water from pouring out when the spout is closed, but if the bottle is laid on its side, there will be some minor seeping over time. Something like an umbrella valve might make this problem go away. The last problem I have is the straw is not quite as rigidly fixed to the top as I'd like. If you fill up the bottle with ice, it is harder to jam the straw all the way to the bottom because it is held to the lid with a flexible fitting (looks like silicone, maybe). The Contigo straw was less likely to wobble around as you pushed it through the ice, which meant it was easier to put on when the bottle was filled with ice.All in all, I'd say the bottle is very good, but the tops are a little lacking. I would simply use the tops to my old Contigo bottles if they had longer straws that went all the way to the bottom of the bottle, but they don't. Iron Flask should seriously consider creating something similar to the old Autospout lids (or even just licensing the design or something). Even if they sold it separately, I think it would be an excellent addition to a very good bottle.

title: Great Flasks!
body: These are by far my favorite water bottles. I have like 7 of them for our family of 5. We've had them for over 2 years now and they are so easy to clean. You never feel like you can quite get a part clean and they don't stink or anything! They are sturdy! We've dropped them on the ground countless times and they are still alive. You can buy new lids and straws if yours does break! These keep things cold for a very long time even in the hot summer heat! They are not leak proof if they are left open but once you close them they are leak proof!

title: Functional, Pretty, Leak-Proof
body: This is my second iron flask purchase--I only purchased a new one because I wanted one that would fit in my car's cup holder. I love the mint green color--and I love the wide straw lid that comes with these iron flask water bottles. It does a great job of keeping my water cold. I haven't tried hot beverages in this, but I'm sure it would do a great job at keeping those hot as well. The only issue I've ever had has been cleaning the lid/gaskets thoroughly, as some reviewers have mentioned previously. However, if you keep up on cleaning them and don't let beverages sit in the water bottle for long, these water bottles will last you a long time. Overall, best bang for your buck for a sturdy, leak-proof, lightweight water bottle. Highly recommend!!

title: Excellent Product and Support
body: I purchased the 64oz bottle to replace my TAL Hydration version of the same size.I realize it seems a bit excessive to get a 64oz bottle but personally I disagree. I know I'm hydrated if that bottle is empty at the end of the day. The best part is if I put a little ice in there, the water is gonna be cold for a long time.In terms of the Iron Flask version it's really got everything I need. 3 different lids to choose from. I usually use the flip top one which is much easier to clean than the screw cap I was using previously. The black/white gradient design is pretty sick as well. Honestly the best part so far has been the customer service. I tried to order a replacement cap for my TAL bottle and waited....and waited. No response, so eventually I cancelled the order and went with Iron Flask. I didn't realize it came with a lifetime warranty until I received it. Messaged support to register my bottle and it was all done within the hour.I may come back to this review in the future as I've only had the bottle a couple weeks but so far so good.

title: Surprising impulse purchase
body: I didn't "need" a water bottle, but all my friends had cups they carried around with them. The IRON °FLASK Sports Water Bottle - 32oz seemed like a practical option -- much cheaper than the hot brands. Now, I don't know what I did without it.The stainless steel double-walled bottle keeps drinks with ice for half-a-day or more. The three options for spouts gives me a choice. Plus, the bottle just looks great: I got the all black model. I expect years of use from the bottle; so, I bought some extra straw caps.

title: Great product
body: I was in the market for a water bottle that would stay cool or hot throughout the day as my job has me on the road every now and then and hydration is a must. I did not want to pay $60 for a hydro flask as I think that’s just absurd. I found iron flask and even though I’ve only have it for about a week or so it keeps my drinks at a consistent tempature which is ultimately what I was looking for. Also what you get sold me a couple of my buddies said when they purchased a hydro flask they only got the wide mouthed top but with the iron flask you get 3 different tops and an extra straw in case one breaks as well as the item having a lifetime warranty. Last but not least the price point is reasonable and will not break the bank which is always a plus.

title: Impressed with the iron flask
body: I recently purchased an Iron Flask and I must say, I am quite impressed.Firstly, the design of the Iron Flask is very sleek and modern. It looks great and I've received a lot of compliments on it. The matte finish is really nice and it doesn't show any fingerprints or smudges. The lid and the handle are also well-designed and easy to use.Secondly, the insulation of the Iron Flask is fantastic. It keeps my water cold for hours, even on hot days. I've also used it to keep my tea hot and it works just as well for that. I was worried that the lid might leak, but it's been completely watertight so far.Thirdly, the size of the Iron Flask is perfect for me. It's not too big and bulky, but it's also not too small. It holds just the right amount of water for me to get through a workout or a day at the office without having to refill it too often.The only reason I'm not giving it a five-star review is because I think the price is a little bit high compared to other water bottles on the market. However, if you're looking for a high-quality water bottle that will last you a long time, then I think the Iron Flask is definitely worth the investment.

title: Great Water!
body: I absolutely love my Iron Flask water bottle! It's the perfect size for staying hydrated throughout the day and the double-walled insulation keeps my drinks cold for hours on end. I also love the fact that it's made with high-quality stainless steel, which means it's both durable and easy to clean.The lid is also very well designed - it has a convenient handle for carrying and a secure snap closure to prevent leaks. Plus, the flip-top lid makes it easy to drink on the go without having to unscrew the entire top.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my Iron Flask water bottle. It's a high-quality product that's both functional and stylish, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a great water bottle!Oh and by the way if anyone is interested Googipet, makes awesome vitamin Chews for dogs to keep your pup happy and healthy.

title: Very unique design
body: This is a great water bottle, if I put ice in it, the ice will last all day until late in the evening. It keeps water ice cold and has not leaked at all. I got this several months ago and it still looks brand new and I havent experienced any issues with it. It came with 3 different lids. I need a straw to motivate myself to drink water, but it came with the straw lid, a wide mouth lid, and a regular lid with a mouthpiece that has a screw-off lid

title: This may sound silly but...
body: I know it sounds dumb to say that a water bottle can make your life better, but I'm saying it anyway. It's not like I don't have a shelf full of water bottles already, some top brands included but none of them were ever "just right". This bottle is perfect for me. I got the 22 ounce wide mouth. It came with 3 lids. It fits in the cup holder in my car which is key for me. I also purchased the silicone boot for the bottom. If you are on the fence don't hesitate. It's a fabulous bottle at a very reasonable price.

title: About to buy my second
body: I had this bottle since 2020. I absolutely loved it, and then the lid cracked when I dropped it. Totally my fault. I emailed customer service asking if I could just purchase a new lid alone and instead they sent me a little mini bottle for free as that was the only way for me to get a new lid. Customer for life now.My little crotch goblin somehow sent my beloved bottle to Narnia. One minute I hear him playing with it and the next, it’s totally vanished. Turned the house upside and can’t find it. So now I’m purchasing another and can’t wait until I’m hydrated once more.

title: Great all around bottle
body: I wanted a bottle that works when sick in bed, on the road or out and about. This works for all those reasons. I like the different lids though I use the straw mostly. It keeps cold though I haven't tried it for 24 hours. I have tried 12 and it remained cold. I like it as much as my corkcicles which are more expensive. I will probably be buying another one.

title: Love these!
body: Bought some for my husband and I. We love them! Does not fade in the dishwasher like most others do. Comes with additional types of lids and none of them leak, all of them do what they say they are going to do. Loved them so much, bought some for all our children for Christmas. We are all water-aholics, having to always have a bottle of water with us everywhere we go. This fits the bill! Yes, pricey, but so very well worth it! I am buying more when I need to. That may be a very long time though.

title: Last Bottle Standing
body: My 8yo has not managed to destroy this water bottle despite her best efforts. For perspective, she's gone through 3 this school year already prior to this one. She thought she'd broken the flip up straw on the lid, but it turns out she'd just popped it off. I was easily able to pop it back into place. It fits into the side pocket of her Jansport backpack. It doesn't get stinky or overly grubby despite going through a school day and not always getting cleaned before being put through another one. Definitely an example of getting what you pay for. I regret nothing. If you're on the fence, hop down and buy it.

title: Can survive car crash unscathed!!
body: I bought my first Iron flask march 2021 and it has been through hell and back yet still looks like I just pulled it out of the box! This will last 5lifetimes if not more. Me and my 40oz flask were in a bad crash early 2022 and has not a single scratch or any indication of damage of any sort. I’ve dropped it too many times to count-yes even on concrete and asphalt- and you can not tell at all. I recently got the 22oz simply because the 40oz does not fit cup holders and is more travel friendly. Tops are interchangeable, and comes with 3 lids plus 2 straws each. Also great for self defense if you have the paracord handle! This will forever be my go to! #customerforlife

title: Fe Fi Fo Flask. I once saw The Man in the Iron Mask.
body: As far as flasks go, this is really nice. So much so, I am actually writing a review and worked in 'Fe' into the headline, because you know, Fe is the chemical symbol for Iron - and this is an Iron Flask. Oh, and that made me think about the Man in the Iron Mask bc 'Iron' is in both, and 'mask' rhymes with 'flask.' ... 5/5 stars.

title: Careful...
body: I bought the 64oz which has a seam in the mouth (the 40oz doesn't) and I looked in there today, not even a week after it arrived, to find rust so just be sure to check every once in awhile that everything is kosure. I'm used to working with cast iron so I know I can scrub it out but it's not really something I want to have to worry about constantly.Other than that I feel like I haven't really been able to give this a fair shot but as mentioned, I bought a 40 oz as well which I'm hoping will be better.Also, I'm rating this as "not easy to drink from" (next section of review asks for a star rating on this feature) because I very much want a super fast, super smooth flow so I can chug like my embrava (not insulated) water bottles but I don't think that I will ever get that from any hot drink lid. Still a pita to have the lids be so... Gluggy and slow pour just because I prefer warm water.

title: Absolutely Fantastic!
body: I needed a new water bottle because my old one started leaking and I wanted to get one of a decent quality for a decent price. I never write reviews but I had to for this.I left this bottle in my car by mistake, overnight and through the day until mid afternoon. I live in Florida and it was 86F. When I drank from it, the water was still cool inside. After 19 hours. In a hot car.Great investment.

title: Fantastic water bottle for the gym or general use
body: I got this water bottle for using at Orange Theory, which involves a lot of time circuit training and running on the treadmill. The lid with the straw spout on it is great for quickly grabbing a drink even while jogging on the treadmill. Also, I sweat a lot, so the larger size is great.Overall, the bottle is so good I actually immediately bought myself a second one for general use at home. Highly recommend!

title: Wow, is all that is needed.
body: This is my husbands 2nd bottle. We had been looking for a large enough water to take to the gym. One that’s easy to drink from, keeps our water super cold and holds the right amount. We have tried others that don’t have a straw and I will tell you it’s a pain in the rear to try and drink from those style bottles. The option to switched tops is nice but the straw is the way to go. Iron Flask is our #1 go to! Great product guys!

title: Mom approved
body: These are the best for my kid to take to school. He never puts it in the little side drink holder on his backpack which means he is throwing it in the big part of his backpack. Other water bottles have leaked and soaked all of his folders and papers! This one has never gotten his backpack or papers wet. This mom approves these bottles. We have three different sizes and we love all of them. My kid has four of the 12-14 oz bottles and I will never switch!! If you are hesitant about purchasing this bottle, rest easy! Buy it!

title: OUTSTANDING customer service!
body: I love this water bottle, however, no matter what I did, I couldn't get rid of the chemical taste. I tried their recommended steps twice, still didn't work. I reached out to ask what else I could try since I really love the actual bottle. They sent me a replacement, no questions asked and it arrived quickly. The BEST customer service I've experienced in quite a while!

title: your drink will stay at the temp you poured it in
body: This is my first vacuum insulated water jug as i used plastic (64oz) ones in the past. I am very happy with I pour cold water in it and its cold even after a couple hours or overnight. i always keep water with me and i wanted a 64 oz as i had in the past to avoid refills. Only thing I would find difficult is that I am used to a handle on the side of the plastic bottles, so along the purchase I bought the iron flask water bottle sleeve made for the 64oz, which has a handle on the side and bonus a shoulder strap to be hands free. Water in the plastic bottle would get to room temp but not this one. i love icy cold water and it stays like that until its empty. I researched a couple vacuum insulated 64 oz bottles and i decided to go with this one and with a week of using it i am happy with it.

title: Ordered two more
body: My wife has only had it long enough to use it twice at work, but she is very happy with it.We put it in the freezer the night before and put some of her drink into an ice cube tray.In the morning we put in the ice cubes, fill her flask, and off to work she goes.Part of her day does require her to be outside, so the Flask does go out with her. Still cold at the end of the day after refilling twice throughout the day.My only complaint is that the discount code they sent us doesn't work on Amazon sales for when we made a second purchase.

title: Great Product
body: I fill this up with ice then continuously add water. I do not have to add ice for 3 days. It is naturally a little heavy when filled but so worth it. Only complaint I have is that it was slightly dented at the bottom corner. I needed it for a trip so did not return it.

title: Most Used Purchase of 2020
body: This water bottle has been great in so many ways. I bought it while pregnant because I knew I’d need an easy way to drink tons of water while breastfeeding and caring for a new baby. Boy was I right! Used it in labor/delivery, all day especially those first few weeks when it was hard to get up and down to get a cup of water, all night when baby woke up to nurse and triggered me to be thirsty, and it was the first water bottle the baby learned to drink from when old enough for water. We always have it on us when we leave the house. We farm and garden and have used it daily on farm trips and it holds up to getting dropped, extreme heat, bitter cold, dirt, sand, cow poop, you name it. The colored powder coating and the rest of the water bottle still looks fantastic.Eventually the straw lid, that I love so much because it allows me to drink a lot of water quickly, started having suction issues, leaking, and eventually the mouthpiece became loose from me fiddling with it trying to get it to work and from cleaning and the kid lost it somewhere after that. Switched to the canteen style lid and didn’t like it.I decided to reach out to Iron Flask to see if they would replace the straw lid and they were super fast to respond to my email and sent me not one, but TWO replacement straw lids (for free). It came with 2 of the actual lids, 4 straws, and 2 straw cleaning brushes! Retail packaging and everything. Very impressive customer service.My only regret with this water bottle was not buying a second one in 40oz and having that one for daytime and the 32oz one that stays clean by the bedside for night time so if I’m tired and the daytime one is dirty I don’t take a dirt covered water bottle into the bedroom. Maybe that’ll be my next gift to myself.My husband has the biggest sized one for work and loves it too. So glad to not be buying him packs of water from the store anymore. Not we spend less, drink less micro plastics and fluoride, and have nice cold water on hand in abundance. I’ve noticed his water consumption has gone way up since he got his and he usually drinks the entire thing during his workday.Highly recommend this product and company.

title: Great product line.
body: This is my third Iron Flask bottle/tumbler. I have been very impressed with their products. I have had ice still in the bottle after 2-3 days. The only issue I had (on my older bottle) was the seal gasket as it got mold spots on it - this was user error as I didn’t pull it out and clean it on a regular basis. I just bought new straw lids + gaskets and they fit both bottles that are different sizes.

title: The perfect bottle for making sure to get her daily water intake.
body: I've had this bottle for over 2 years and still love it. It's sturdy and keeps my water very cold. The straw makes it very easy to drink from. It's heavy duty so it's best sitting on my counter throughout the day and I use smaller, lighter bottles when on the go. Highly recommend.

title: Heavy Duty Water Flask
body: I use this flask everyday to try to drink at least this full amount during the day. This is a solid flask, keeps the water cold for the entire day. Easy to use flip up straw to drink from. Comes with a second lid that doesn't have a straw.

title: Stays cold. Or hot!
body: I am a die-hard Iron Flask lover. From my first purchase it's been a quality item. Recently I purchased the 64oz and the coffee cup, matching of course! So in summary, buy it! There are others out there, but Iron Flask is a bargain and it works!!

title: Water bottle obsession
body: I have a slight fever obsession with water bottles. I carry them with me everywhere. This 64 Oz bottle is perfection. Helps me easily meet my daily water goal and keeps water cold for a very long time. It’s a well made, sturdy bottle.

title: Solid Product!
body: Used this on vacation in Grenada to keep my drinks cold at the beach. Ice lasted all day and drinks stayed nice and cold. Great variety in the different lids they provide. A very solid water bottle I would purchase again.

title: Very nice!
body: Easy to clean, and easy to carry/use. Impressed with the cold property so far - kept water cold of over 30 hours with Ice still remaining. I have not tried it with hot liquids yet, but intend to use it just for cold anyway. So far, a very good product for the cost!

title: Perfect size for travel
body: I bought this for traveling overseas. It was the perfect size, fits in the backseat pocket of the plane and in my crossbody bag. The interchangeable lids are perfect and the wide opening is easy for filling and cleaning.

title: Awesome!! My new Go To!
body: these are just as good as my Yeti but lower costs—- which will keep me a customer since I have teens that take them, and lose them on the regular, so replacing often! LolLOVE the color options too!

title: Keeps drinks nice and cold
body: I've been using this for more than a month now and I am very satisfied with how cold it keeps my drinks. I put ice in my lemonade in the morning and there is still ice in the drink before I go to bed! I raved about it so much that my husband asked me to order one for him and he loves his too!

title: Just the best bottle you can buy
body: The bottle feels so strong, I love the paint quality overall.I also think the different caps are a huge win, you can have so many choices.The packaging also was great and had no issues with transportation.

title: Great hydro flask!
body: Looks just just the picture, the blue marbled color is really so pretty. built really well, I’ve dropped it a few times and hasnt scratched or dented. Use it everyday. Love that it has a handle for carrying.

title: Love this bottle!
body: Got this bottle a while back for a good work bottle to bring back and forth. This thing seals up tight and keeps drinks cold for a long time. I can often fill it halfway with ice and water and there will still be ice in it over 24 hours later. Bottle cannot be cleaned by hand without a bottle brush as the opening is too small for your hand but that’s only a minor inconvenience. Definitely recommend.

title: Keep your Stanley, I'll take my Iron flask.
body: I have owned LOTS of vacuum insulated stainless steel bottles and this is definitely my favorite. In fact, I own two iron flasks, one in the 64oz size that I keep in my fridge at home and this one, that I take with me on the go (since the 64 oz one is just too big to tote around). I love the lid options (the straw lid is my current favorite but it's nice to be able to shake it up sometimes). I love the color. I love the quality! I bought the silicone boot to go on the bottom which I would definitely recommend. Also, this does a good job of keep beverages cold, but I find the perfect combination is this bottle plus 3-4 reusable silicone ice cubes. My water stays ICE ICE cold all day long!I have zero complaints about this bottle and highly recommend this brand if you're in the market.I sincerely hope this review has been helpful to someone else! And yes, I paid full price for both of them. Feel free to ask any questions!

title: Good overall experience with product and company
body: Had an all red one for about 2 months before it got stolen, like it enough to get a replacement but it had a minor dent at the bottom. Customer service was helpful in getting that situation resolved quickly and without hassle. All things considered pretty good experience overall with the product and iron flask as a company, would recommend.For the bottle itself, it keeps drinks the same temperature they were put in for quite a while, poured hot water in at night when it was too hot to drink comfortably and then next morning it was a pleasant level of hot. From what I noticed the outer part of the bottle doesnt change temperature due to the drink inside.Lids, they all work though personal preference plays a big part in which you like best. Screw on lid is great for keeping drink temperature the same for longer but isnt great for frequent quick sips. Flip top is good but drinking from the bottle may be difficult for people with larger noses or larger bottle sizes due to the weight and since the hole is so recessed in the lid. Straw lid is convenient with ease of use and cleaning (inner section is removable and comes with a spare), solid top section doesnt feel the best since its rectangular shaped but you get used to it

title: Great Flask
body: Bought a 32 oz Hydroflask as a souvenir while visiting Glacier National Park. Love the flask, but very pricy, and too large to fit the drink holders in my cars. So I decided to get a smaller bottle to take in the car. Chose the 22 oz Iron Flask. Every bit as nice as the Hydroflask, and substantially cheaper. Very, very happy with it.

title: Pretty colors!
body: Love the colors options! Nice sturdy bottle and no "sweating". My ice so far seems to last about 2 full days. I bought for work. Might be ordering another another that fits in cup holders.

title: Buy without worry.
body: This is a very well made product with a lifetime warranty. My wife and I each have one of these. We used the warranty for my wife’s due to the lid not sealing and it couldn’t be easier. The customer service staff was excellent and problem solved quickly.Now, we’re just back to enjoying them. I 100% recommend them.

title: Nice Water bottle
body: TLDR: 22oz. Three lids two straws. 24hour temp hold. If there’s remaining water in spout sometimes gets into straw bed. Overall leak proof.I got the 22oz iron flask, came with three lids and two straw inserts. Keeps my water cold for over 24 hours (with ice still partially intact) the straw is the order length however sometimes a bit of water pools in the area that the straw lays in, but other only if there’s water left in the spout, overall leak proof.

title: sturdy
body: I drop this thing at least once a day and there is never a mark to be seen. I suck at drinking water so carrying this big boy (40oz) around really helps me remember

title: Awesome bottle
body: Let me start off by saying that I just had this delivered a few hours ago so my review will be based off a short timeframe.I was blown away with my first impression of this bottle. I mainly got it to use the straw lid and was worried it would be loud. I planned on using this bottle mostly at night by my bed, so I wanted a quieter one. So far, it seems to be fairly quiet.The colors are also amazing and are pretty true to the pictures on here. Very happy with this purchase.

title: Great but…
body: I like these water bottles. So much that I bought two to last longer. Great to drink from, excellent to last, and great sizes provided. I bought the 32 oz ones. Here’s the downside-they don’t keep it cold for 24 hours. I put ice and water in there every day and the ice lasts for maybe an hour or 2 and the cold only lasts for 8 hours max. Had these for about a year but looking for something that lasts longer for cold

title: I love it!
body: Not to much to say. I can leave water with ice in it over night and still have ice the next day, the price point is good. It came with multiple tops and a straw option that I personally prefer. I work in a manufacturing plant and it gets beay up and dropped every day and there isnt a scratch on it. Exactly what I was looking for when I purchased.

title: My second round of these bottles
body: Love these bottles. Family uses this brand exclusively. After about 2 years we had just beat them up too much. But still kept contents cold and ice still lasted. Can’t ask for more than that, when I’m the one dropping it.I give these as gifts, they’ve been great and a much better price than most. Kids are replaceable for a good price as well. All in all, happy

title: Great water bottle
body: This water bottle helps keep me on track with my water intake each day. I can put ice in it in the morning and the same ice will keep each refill nice and cold throughout the day. I really hate room temperature water so the fact it keeps the water cold is what's so major for me.

title: Good water bottle
body: It's a good water bottle easy to clean easy to use. And keeps my water cool for 12+ hours which is wild to me. I love it. Definitely worth the buy.

title: Ready for summer
body: Bought this for our 8 year old daughter who’s in cheer. She loved it and her water stays super cold - she’s ready for those Texas football games in August 🥵

title: KEEPS ICE FOR DAYS
body: The best waterbottle for a cheap price! Stop buying these over priced waterbottles that don’t even keep you drinks cold, just because they’re trending. Iron flask is where it’s at!

title: Replaced my Yeti
body: I lost my old 36oz yeti to a U Haul, and it was the old style with a purchased straw lid ($13) and they don't make them the same anymore. I was looking for an alternative and found this, my boss had one so I decided to try it. I LOVE this bottle. It's lightweight but durable and keeps things just as cold as my yeti. It's cheaper AND comes with 3 lids at no extra cost! Idk how I slept on this bottle but I can't recommend it enough! And they're so pretty too.

title: Pretty!
body: Hot stays hot and cold is very cold with ice added hardly melts in 24 hours. Interior cleans very easy, caps/covers are smart and versatile, my pretty favorite!

title: Great flask new designs
body: My flask was gifted to me. In return I gifted to my daughter and two grandaughters, each a flask. My friend was told by her Dr that she needs to drink more water, she hates water. So I surprised her and sent her a flask. The confetti design was so fun. She loved it. I told her to use plenty of ice with her water, maybe some lemon or lime juice and keep the flask filled and by her side at all times. That’s what I do. Never out of arms reach. Because of the ease of use and water stays cold with the ice, I’m drinking more water and staying hydrated. So is my friend and grandaughters!

title: Best water bottle
body: I finally found the ideal insulated water bottle, the IRON flask F water bottle 22oz. It is really well made and comes with 3 different lids. One of which has a straw, a feature I was looking for. It keeps cold drinks cold and hot drinks hot. Customer service is great also.

title: Mom Approved!
body: I got this as a gift for my mom and she loves it! She’s had it for 3 years now and it’s still her water bottle of choice. It holds her drinks cold and keeps them hot whenever she wants. It also looks super cute with stickers on them! My mom LOVES it.

title: yes
body: 10/5. Customizable. Easy to carry. Made of real iron. Holds liquids very well. 10/5. I try selling this to everyone I know. IRON FLASK should hire me.

title: Great bottle!
body: Great water bottle! The flow of water through the spout is great! I have the 40 oz and it is perfect! I love the three choices of lids and extra straw that come with the bottle! Bottle keeps the ice cold for days! For the price, this is a great bottle!

title: Exactly as described
body: I wanted a water bottle that is easy to drink from, easy to clean, and keeps water cold. This flask is the perfect fit, especially for traveling and having water close by at night. I ordered more after using the first one. I also appreciated how quickly i received the items.

title: Great quality, great price.

title: Overall happy with the flask. Seems to be keeping the temperature pretty well.
body: Overall happy with the flask. Seems to be keeping the temperature pretty well. I still have to figure out the best way to clean it because I use the straw with the lid, and I am not sure how I can clean the small hole on the lid more efficiently.

The only strange thing is it didn’t come with the rubber base on it like my last one, and I miss that. Otherwise, this is perfect!

title: Happy, Hydrated
body: Definitely sturdy and easy to use all around. Loved that it came with multiple cover options! Fits my cup holders in my car & peloton! Everything is almost 5 stars — but it’s a little leaky, especially if you fill it up to a certain point then put the cover on. Or if the straw is out and tips. Otherwise, good one!

title: High quality. Easy to clean. Sleek design.
body: I usually don’t write reviews, but when I stumble on a really high quality product out of nowhere I just can’t help myself. Highly recommend.

title: Not to easy to clean but still worth it
body: Honestly, I really like this bottle, it's pretty thin so it fits in the cup holder in my car ( I bet it fits in most cars). I was looking for something made of metal or different from plastic because I hate the smell of plastic bottles after washing and washing really hard. The only two things that I don't like about this bottle it's that the lid is made of plastic, so of course it's gonna smell if you drink coffee or put some protein in your bottle, and also it the fact that is too thin is also bad because that makes it harder to clean deep your bottle. Other than that, I like the bottle, I never tried Flask ever before but I would buy from them again, maybe a bigger bottle but I'm pretty sure I would.

title: Great Bottle
body: Keeps my water ice cold all day long while at clinical! I love this bottle so much that I have the matching coffee mug!

title: 5 Star Water Bottle!
body: This is the best water bottle I have every used. It keeps my water cold, easy to drink while driving, nice handle to hold while hiking and fits in my car's drink holder. I have tried many and this is 5 stars in my book!

title: Straw lid too small
body: This is a great bottle. It will keep your ice without melting for hours, just put enough ice. However, the straw lid's sipping hole is extremely small. You have to work hard to get a mouthful. If you don't use this lid, no problem. However if you like to use this lid go with the Hydro Cell insulated bottles. The picture with the tiny opening is the IronFlask bottle, pink. The large opening is the Hydra Cell opening, red. Women, you can get early wrinkles around the mouth using small straws. Just saying. I love the big opening on the lids on the Hydro Cell bottles.

title: LOVE IT!
body: One of the best purchases I've ever made. I've used this water bottle every day (literally) for a little over a year and it still looks and works as if it's brand new. The color hasn't faded and it hasn't dented- and I haven't exactly been gentle with it. The lids and plastic straws haven't been compromised even though I run them in the dishwasher to sanitize them. I mostly use the straw lid, but it's nice having the extra lids to use when washing the straw lid. I was worried that lugging around a half gallon by the handle would eventually strip the plastic screw pattern of the lid or break the handle, but they're still going strong. This bottle will probably last a lifetime unless I toss it off a mountain or something. I love the color choices. I'm tempted to buy a few others just for the colors even though I really don't need them. I definitely recommend Iron Flask, especially if you're an outdoorsy type. I fill mine up with ice and water and it will stay cold for many hours even when left in a hot car. These bottles would make great gifts too. Love it!

title: Best water bottle you can buy
body: This bottle is 10/10. It has a great look, keeps drinks cold all day, and the straw is somehow easier to drink from than any other water bottle I’ve tried. Also love that it comes with 3 different lid options and a lifetime warranty!

title: DELICIOUS!
body: I was buying this ramen in 2021 and 2022, but price went way up. So stopped buying it.Checked Amazon a few days ago and priced dropped.It is March 2023 so reordered case.These ramens come in a big box.Noodle packages are large, substantial noodles, spicy seasoning and dried vegetables packet.These are the best ramen noodles I have ever eaten, ever!I am a big ramen and cup of noodle person and tried many.This product is by far one of the best.I cook noodles about 6 minutes so they are extra plump.Drain almost all water, then add 1/2 to 3/4 spicy seasoning and a small amount of soy sauce too. Then lastly, add dried veg pack.Or you can add full spicy seasoning pack, but it is super hot.These ramens are so good and much better quality than cheap ramens in store, like Nissan or Matachan. Those have no flavor at all.Once you try this ramen, you will be addicted and not want low quality ones in store, which have no flavor and taste like soap.
