title: Great flavor, good base, easy to customize
body: This is my go-to quick ramen. I love the spice level and the flavor, and it’s good as is, or how I normally cook it: adding whatever protein/veg I have around. If nothing else, I’ll crack an egg or two into the simmering soup for the last minute, giving me a soft poached egg and a complete meal.This is spicy enough not to be boring, but it’s still on the comforting level, not too challenging. Funnily enough, I do add salt; this is the first packaged brand that doesn’t have enough for me.Buying this by the case makes it a bit cheaper per package, and they are a pantry staple.

title: Better than the reviews
body: About the package-I usually buy this ramen in packs of 4 at Walmart or The Farmers market. However they've been out of stock due to the holidays and a small food shortage. So I decided to just cough up the 20$ rather than wait months for it to go back in stock! I'm really glad it came in 2 boxes rather than 1 singular box. I was scared things would leak onto the package or something may have been tampered with due to the reviews. Thankfully my package arrived safe, on time and in good condition!!Ramen Review-This ramen is really good if you like maruchan then you'll like this. It's basically a premium version of maruchan. BUT you do have to season it yourself and maybe add your toppings if you want a little extra. It does come with a spicy sauce packet, dried veggies and of course the noodles. I think it's a really good base, you just have to season it! ^^ and yes all 20 packs were in the box. 😂

title: It has a nice punch of heat but more importantly HUGE in flavor

The broth is velvety, smoothed, and absolutely packed with flavor. The noodles themselves seem to be fairly high quality and seem to even take being slightly overcooked well. title: Just buy them already!!!
body: If you’ve had these before they’re exactly what you want 20 packs of 2 serving bags just like they sell in the grocery store. My local store in Maine doesn’t carry these and my love affair with them is not about to end on those terms! If you haven’t had these before they’re HOT I personally have to add about 1 tbsp of water to the pot so I can tolerate them. That being said I also think jalapeños are HOT so if you like spice they probably won’t hit you as hard. The spice is like a numbing immediate heat and the broth is super flavorful, I will literally eat a whole package (2 servings) myself and drink ALL of the broth even though the spice has me sweating! Highly recommend a glass of milk and even a slice of shokupan or white bread. If you’re looking for something spicy, tasty, and hearty stop looking! As a side note the dehydrated vegetables are BEAUTIFUL nice chunks of mushroom, carrots, peppers and green onions!

title: Doubled price
body: My mom bought and bought in bulk because she loved the spicey flavor. I bought a bulk package as well and today they doubled in price!!!! Not worth that much. Wont be purchasing again.

title: Better than Black
body: These can be better than black at a portion of the price. You need a few things, the 1st part is sautéed mushrooms once the water is out i add a dab of anchovies paste and soysauce then I portioned out two TBS into freezer bags. This is my tare. If you get rotisserie chickens, take the meat you want n make stock with remains carrot celery onion black peppercorns bayleaf and garlic cloves, cover with cold water. DO NOT ADD SALT. It takes about 3 hours will be sooner if you break the bones. Strain it 2x through a double fine mesh, chill in fridge, remove fat off the top once cooled, potion the amount you would use for ramen. So remove a frozen potion of NO SALT stock, frozen mushroom tare. Place in pot under medium heat let thaw n come to a low boil. Place is soup packet n veggie packet n mix, add noddles boil for 4 mins (drop in a raw egg for the last 45 sec if you want!!) remember the difference between this and Black is black comes with an anchovy soup base packet and dehydrated shitake mushrooms.

title: Next level Ramen secret trick
body: I used to purchase the Black Shin ramen. It's literally the best instant ramen out there as far as I could find. Nongshim Shin ramen is good. Same noodles, dried vegetables, and very similar spicy flavoring as the Black Shin. Only thing missing in the Nongshim Shin is the bone broth powder concentrate that's included with Black Shin. In my opinion that's the only thing which makes the Black Shin better (and more expensive).Now here's the trick to save money and create a ramen even better than Black Shin. Next time you buy this ramen also purchase "Japanese Noodles Tonkotsu Ramen Concentration Pork Bone Soup". Use approx. half a pack of the pork bone soup concentrate (save the other half for later use), noodles, dried vegetables and spicy powder. This not only takes your ramen game to the next level it also allows you to adjust the spiciness without losing flavor. And in my opinion it's healhier because the pork bone soup concentrate is 100% natural (water, salt and pork bone).

title: My favorite spicy instant noodles!
body: These have been my favorite instant noodles since I was a kid, and they still hold a sweet spot in my heart! They’re incredibly easy to prepare, and easy to make into a fancier meal by adding vegetables, meat, and other toppings. There are two main ways that I usually prepare these. One is my “lazy” method and the other is still easy but a tiny bit more time consuming.1. Lazy method: Use a bowl big enough to fit the noodles with around two inches to spare. Pour the spice mix on top, and pour boiling water into your bowl. Cover with a lid immediately and let sit for around 5 minutes. Stir and enjoy!2. Less lazy method: Bring a small sauce pot to a boil on the stove and add the noodles and spices. Cook for around 3-5 minutes depending on your texture preference. Stir a few times and make sure to separate the noodles so they cook evenly.For both these methods, I’d recommend adding leafy vegetables (spinach, Napa cabbage), poached egg (you can crack a raw egg directly into your pot about two minutes before the noodles are done in method 2), and possibly some meat (pork belly, rotisserie chicken, spam, anything else you have lying around). If you’re feeling extra adventurous, top it with a slice of American cheese! It sounds weird, but it’s delicious!The only warning that I’d give is that the spicy powder can get quite spicy. I usually only use about half the packet, otherwise I am crying and sniffling the entire time I’m eating my meal. Start off with just a little bit and adjust to your taste!

title: Tips for toothy texture and springiness Hints added
body: Good and spicy much better than the cheapo maruchan, and still not expensive. The noodles are great. Just the right amount of toothy texture and springiness. To make these "American" version noodles a bit spicier I add a little Gochujang Hot. Also the vegetables are dried differently. Try soaking for about 5-10 minutes in a small bowl of boiled water. I also squirt a small amount of sesame oil in the bottom of my noodle bowl and sprinkle my spice pack over the oil and shake the bowl to even it out over the bottom. drain and add veggies, then noodles, add boiling water , cover bowl for no more than 3 minutes. stir with chopsticks and eat while hot or noodles will get soggy.FOR SUPPER NOODLES - prepare pork beef or chicken meat just before noodles and cut into strips. In a separate bowl add meat chopped onion and Gochujang, ad to bowl and stir after the 3 min wait right before eating. I also sometimes add a fried or soft boiled egg making sure yolk is liquid to mix into broth, but add the egg before the meat. do not stir the meat with the noodles or they WILL get SOGGY! I also add Wei Chuan Chili Bamboo Shoots from a jar, which I have not found on Amazon yet. I usually get a few jars at a time from Asian market when I go. For the chicken skinless boneless thigh meat works best. For pork boneless country style ribs work best. For beef have top cab sirloin cut thick about 2 inches and cut into sections to marinade for about 5 days freeze what you are not using after marinating. Roast chicken or pork in preheated oven seasoned as you like at high temp (400-450 F) for about 20-38 min, turning half way through. The beef you can sear in a wok or skillet and leave rare but slice very thin. slice the meat up add the Gochujang, and onions a little Mirin a small cap full of rice vinegar, and the chopped onion. Mix well add to noodles right as you are ready to eat, and press down with chopsticks to mix the juices. To mix well push the meat down rapidly with chopsticks a few times. The meat is the last thing to go on, except stuff like bean sprouts and bamboo shoots. Nothing makes me feel better like this stuff!!!

title: A blank canvas.

The real magic happens when you add to it.This is how I do it.I add 1 Tbsp of vegetable broth, one egg, some turmeric, a tiny bit of ginger, and tiny chunks of ham.The tiny chunks of ham really carry this stuff and the turmeric makes it feel healthy.I like how they're shaped in a circle and is easier to put in a pot. Compared to the cost it's a decent deal but only if you love spicy food.It's cheap and way better than many alternatives. Avoid it if you can't do spicy though!

title: Blows the competition out of their broth!
body: Hands down the best flavor of instant ramen I have ever tried. The noodles are thicker than most and have a nice bite to them, staying fairly firm even if they are "overcooked". The flakes packet is a nice variety of green onion, pepper flakes, shaved carrots, and Shiitake mushrooms, lending the soup even more flavor(I recommend adding them before heating to ensure everything is flavored up). And the soup powder? Incredible. An aromatic, meaty flavor that brings some serious heat. This isn't even to mention the generous 2 portions in one packet, which rounds this out into a flavorful, hearty bowl of ramen.

title: Delicious! Noodles have nice texture - If you like spicy broths, this ramyun is for you!
body: This ramyun is one of my favorites. The noodles have a really nice texture with a slight chewiness that puts cheaper ramens to shame. The broth is rich and spicy.I like my broth extremely hot, so I augment my ramyun with whatever hot peppers from my garden are ready to be picked. I drop in some dried birds eye chills and pepper flakes on top of that. In other words, if it doesn’t make you cough while it’s cooking… it’s not hot enough ;)What I really like about this ramyun is that it is extremely versatile. Just dump in whatever ingredients you like and then enjoy. The photo I took has a bowl with handful of sliced mushrooms, some avocado slices and an egg I poached during the last three minutes of cooking. I also added some sliced garlic and green onions. If you like shrimp, drop in a few of those for a nice seafood broth variation.And… if hot broth is not your thing, I highly recommend Shin Black. It’s a nice pork broth…and it’s my daughter’s favorite.

title: Outstanding Quality and Taste
body: Flavor is outstanding as it is, but with additional sauces and spices to my liking, the noodle and soup is amazing. It's like restaurant quality at home.The noodle itself is also of great quality. I can allow it to sit for a good 10-15 minutes for the soup to cool down, and still won't get that soggy texture.One package with sufficient water for soup is enough to satisfy my hunger, especially when I need a quick meal. While I pay for the quality of the noodle and taste, a price reduction during this current inflation crisis shouldn't be too much to ask for.Overall, I'm totally satisfied. My favorite ramen noodle to date.

title: Wow!
body: When my son came home from school asking for these pencils, I though he just liked being able to twist up the erasers. In all fairness, that is the feature that excited him the most, but he kept saying they were easy to write with and his hand wasn't as tired after using it. I do my best to get my kids school supplies that they enjoy using because I know how much more I enjoy my own work when I have tools and supplies that work well or I like for whatever reason. So while a pencil choice might sound a bit silly, I see it as a way of encouraging my kids at school.Compared to other pencils, these aren't exactly cheap, so I initially picked up a 2 pack at a local store, hoping my son would get his fascination with the twist eraser out of his system and this would be the end of it. But when I actually used the pencil? Well let's just say it's the first time in my life I've said 'Wow' after writing with a pencil. It's so incredibly smooth! It actually writes smoother than many pens I've used. And it does not break nearly as easily as most other pencils we've used, mechanical or wooden. So off to Amazon I went to purchase more at a better price, because mom wants a few of these pencils now, too.Now, personally, I'm not super jazzed about the twist eraser as the eraser likes to twist itself out while in my purse (not all the way out, but out enough that I have to twist it back in before each use). This is probably because I don't use pencils often so it sits in my purse getting jostled around for quite a while before it gets pulled out. My son does not have this issue with the ones in his backpack, as he uses them every day at school. He also uses the eraser a lot, so having an extra long eraser is not only 'cool', it's practical for him.One could just buy the strong-yet-buttery-smooth lead refills and put them in a cheaper pencil, if you don't have need or desire for the extra eraser. But this pencil is also very comfortable in my hand, lightweight and balanced well, so I haven't bothered to do that personally. Still, it's an option if you prefer a different pencil design.

title: Everything in a pencil !
body: I've had a favorite pencil for years and have spent top dollar on them.Until now.My husband just thanked me for buying these pencils for his propagating business. they are tough , no smear, clear writing and the lead doesnt break . he uses them for writing tags on his plants. he's searched forever for the right pencil for this job and this is it !i use them for writing everything- lists, notes, calendars - anything needing a dependable pencil with an eraser that works! not some dinky piece of plastic eraser but a large, twist up clean working eraser that is perfect in removing every trace.i think they are made with kids in mind because of the price point and the durability, and the strong lead and the great eraser. but for perfectionist adults , they are the bomb!

title: BEST mechanical pencil ever!!!
body: I have used numerous mechanical pencils and this is by far the BEST ever! The lead does not break and is very dark so you can see it. Dataset is great and it was the most economical. Thank you Pentel!!

title: Absolutely fantastic pencil!!!
body: I never dreamed that a simple pencil could have such an effect on life. I know this may sound stupid for a simple pencil, but bear with me.I originally ordered this because I have Parkinson's and had been using .7mm pencils for years but was having a great deal of problems with the leads breaking when I had a spasm. I decided to try this pencil because it had a .9mm lead and I thought that it just MIGHT help with the lead breaking problem so I ordered one. Well, it worked very well for the breakage problem. I haven't broken a lead since I started using this pencil. However, I have discovered other great benefits. The new retracting eraser smooths the whole erasing thing out nicely and makes eraser longevity and changing much less of a problem. The larger soft rubber grip also makes the pencil a LOT easier to hang on to, especially for those with my condition.One improvement I have learned to make on the grip: The fattest part of the grip, as it comes, is at the top and doesn't add to the ergonomics of holding the pencil much. I have found that if you simply unscrew and remove the bottom of the pencil where the lead comes out, the rubber grip can simply be slipped off, turned around and reinstalled. Now the fat part of the grip is at the bottom and keeps the fingers in a more sure and comfortable position. The way the manufacturer delivers them doesn't make sense in this respect.However, this pencil is a quantum leap in usability over every other pencil I have ever used and I have since thrown out every other pencil in the house and replaced them with this one.Thank you Pentel for making a better product to simplify our lives.

title: Great mechanical pencil!
body: I've always loved mechanical pencils, from the time I used the old Scripto pencils when I was in high school in the late '60s. I've felt guilty about using the cheap disposable ones from the dollar store, because they just add plastic waste to the landfills. Finally I decided to get some quality pencils that could be refilled, just like my beloved high-school Scriptos. These Pentel pencils are great! The have a metal point that holds the lead nice and steady, and they feel solid in the hand. Looking forward to using these for many years!

title: Writes and Erases well.
body: Like the way it feels in my hand. I am able to write well with this pencil, despite my difficulties with handwriting. Sometimes the led does not come out right away, but that is typically after I let my students write with it, so who knows! Eraser works well.

title: Gift for a young artist

title: best lead pencils ever
body: This is a great product I've been using these for over 20 years and I'm so glad that Pentel still makes them. I love the 5 mm size it works the best for me. I would highly recommend these pencils.

title: Best pencil I've found for my kids
body: I've tried numerous pencils for my grade-school kids and I think these are the best.Why?They're cheap, less than $2 per.They easily take refills. Some of the cheaper pencils make it hard to put in refills.The lead guide is metal.The lead is darker than typical.And the biggest reason...The eraser is HUGE. Even though my kids have separate erasers, they seem to never grab those, but instead use the erasers on their pencils. That means on many of their pencils, the erasers are worn down. And on many pencils, the eraser must be removed to put in more lead. When the eraser is worn down to the nub, it's really hard to pull it out to add more lead.Another nice thing about this pencil: the lead refills do not go where the eraser goes. So even when the huge eraser is worn all the way, it's still easy to add more lead.

title: Best Value :
body: Best ergonomics, utility and Value for the $ .. .

title: Nice Pencil
body: This Pentel Twist Erase XP has a precise and reliable lead propelling mechanism. The long Eraser works well and lasts a long time.The twist-erase mechanism on this model has enough drag to prevent (mostly) the irritating problem of the eraser creeping out while writing, as happens to me with other Pentel Twist Erase Pencils.An annoyance is that the rubber grip has a lot of friction inside my shirt pocket. When I pull it out, the top part of the pencil sometimes pulls off, leaving the end in my pocket. This happens with several models of Pentel cushioned-grip pencils. I decided I like the cushioned grip enough to put up with the minor drawback.

title: Getting to the point about this pencil
body: Without a doubt, Pentel Twist-Erase Mechanical Pencils are the ultimate mechanical pencils.Here is what you get: a dozen mechanical pencils with 0.9mm HB refills (equivalent to a number 2 pencil), that always stay sharp and NEVER break, a white polymer eraser that doesn't tear pages, doesn't leave ghost images, and lasts for what seems like an eternity. The silicone grip is comfortable without being too bulky. These pencils are durable and virtually maintenance-free and will last many years if they don't grow legs and walk away. The fact that they are green simply makes me smile!I have used the Pentel Twist-Erase pencils for years. In fact, I have some that are "ancient" and still work as well as if I had purchased them yesterday. In earlier years, there weren't color choices, they didn't have a soft grip, and I felt grateful just to find one of these pencils with a 0.9mm refill.Pentel also makes options available if you prefer a 0.5mm lead (which I break very often) and 0.7mm lead (which are okay if that's your preference). Even at 0.9mm, which is considered a bold/wide/broad refill, the refill still maintains an excellent point as if it were just recently sharpened. In fact, I have passed along all my mechanical pencils that have anything except 0.9mm refills because that is the size for me.I can with complete confidence recommend these pencils. In my opinion, there are none better.

title: I can’t get the pencil to work after I refill the lead.

title: A teacher's honest opinion
body: These are the absolute best mechanical pencils I have ever used. They are strong and lasting. The lead size is perfect for strength.

title: Great pencils

title: Not the best
body: Bought these for my business. The biggest complaint I have is the pencil comes apart very easily. Probably fine if you’re sitting at a desk but if you keep it in your shirt pocket like I do, I’d suggest something else.

title: Best Mechanical Pencil ever!
body: I absolutely love these! Already had two but wanted more. and they have refillable erasers that last longer than those short one on other pencils. Bought the lead and extra erasers to go with it. Don't write with anything else. Recommend

title: School necessity
body: Great working pencil for back to school!

title: Best-designed mechanical pencils
body: I've been a fan of Pentel Twist-erase pencils for over a decade. For me, the design is just right as far as functionality goes: the eraser is always available, and is easy to adjust with a simple twist of the pencil body halves. There's no cap blocking access, so it's quick and easy to correct mistakes - and I make a lot.There's a rubbery grip near the tip to keep my fingers from slipping off the pencil, and the lead adjustment is straightforward with a couple of clicks on the eraser to extend or retract.Specifics about this particular model: Twist-Erase EXPRESS 0.9mm Fashin Color Orange -- 0.9mm lead is great for bold, easy writing (other thicknesses available: 0.1mm, 0.3mm, 0.5mm, 0.7mm)- Orange color (transparent) makes it stand out on a cluttered desktop (other colors could be used for other thicknesses to make swapping between them easy.)- durable and reliable- Twist-Erase EXPRESS body is substantially thinner than Twist-Erase III version which I had been using for years.

title: Definitely Durable
body: This mechanical pencil is the best! Several of mine are over 8 years old and are my prized possessions. When taking minutes for several organizations I prefer to use Pentel pencils which are comfortable to hold, have leads in different hardness (I prefer mine to write darker), and the twist eraser is easy to maneuver and erases clean. Unfortunately, everyone wants to barrow my pencils and thus, they disappear.... I tried other brands but they do not hold up to this product's durability. Others are cheap plastic and the metal tips and pocket clips break off.

title: Best mechanical pencils
body: These pencils are amazing. Lots of lead is included but the best part is the huge twist up eraser!

title: Pencil is fine! Lead is horrible!
body: I wonder if these pencils do not use Pentel quality lead! The lead is NOT HB! It is "super hard lead!" No matter how gently I write with this pencil it cuts through the paper. (When I press light enough to not tear the paper, it does not write!) Each pencil comes with a VERY short and VERY hard piece of lead in the pencil. Grab your HB lead refill and add them to this box of pencils so you can add FRESH PENTEL LEAD to each pencil as you discover none of them write! Pencils seem to be of good quality, I have added real HB lead to them repeatedly and they work fine. If you treat them like "lead ready" pencils, you will be happy with your purchase! :-)

title: Pentel
body: I ordered these for school. I needed them because I didn’t have pencils. Liked the price and amount I received.

title: great pencils if you don't keep them in your pocket
body: Ok I really like these except that when I keep them in my scrubs pocket the top comes off when I go to pull them out and the barrel/eraser part detaches and the lead spills out, very annoying but if I didn't try to keep them in a pocket they'd work fine. I would prefer that they stay together a bit better. Other than that they are great, sturdy pencils

title: Good Quality
body: For years, I've purchased Bic mechanical pencils, but in recent years, I've noticed they just aren't the same quality they used to be. The parts are all plastic, and in just a short time, they stop "gripping" the lead so that it slips back up into the pencil when you try to write with them. Also, the Bic pencils come with very fragile lead that snaps in two with just the least pressure, and their erasers are small and not replaceable. These Pentel pencils are a much better quality! They have a metal part that grips the lead...no slippage. The eraser is very long and can be replaced when it is used up, and the lead that comes in the pencil is a good quality...you can actually write with it without breakage. The grip is nice, too...very comfortable. The only thing not to love is the fact that when you use the eraser, you have to hold the twisting section that raises and lowers the eraser or it will twist all the way back into the pencil, and you will find yourself rubbing the paper with the plastic surrounding the eraser. Once you know to hold this part, it's fine.

title: Not durable
body: As I became sick of wooden pencils and cheap pencils, I decided to invest in this Pentel-Twist pencil. I am not happy with the pencil. The graphite/led in the pencil constantly gets loose and doesn't do its job. This is fixable, but it is a process to fix, which is not good in a situation where you are taking a test or something time-consuming. I do have to say, the price is great, and when the pencil works it is great. The pencil also has a long twist-eraser so you don't have to be worried about using up the eraser. The biggest problem of the pencils are that they are not durable enough, leading to the led loosening up.

title: Caveat Emptor
body: I first used the Pentel Twist Erase pencil 3 years ago as I was searching for a good mechanical pencil with a refillable eraser. I have not used any other since. I loved it for all the reasons other buyers have mentioned--large/long refillable eraser, rubber grip (not perfect but better than nothing), and interchangeable parts in case something breaks. I was hesitant to purchase this one, the "Express XP", since it was not the same item I was used to.The original, if taken apart would be four pieces (apart from led/eraser). This pencil is only three pieces, since the pocket clip (now a more flexible plastic) is one piece with the upper barrel. BTW, the eraser that fitted the original also fits the Express XP.I've seen the original pencils sell for $3.00 apiece, but this set was a dozen for much less. So a cheaper and simpler design, construction, and material.But when it comes to performance, this pencil has a flaw. With every one of these pencils I had, both my wife and I experienced that sometimes the lead would break inside the tip so it would be stuck in the tip. This happened A LOT--if it didn't I wouldn't mention it or feel the need to edit my original review (which was five stars by the way, but the one who uses an item for years is not the same as the one who uses it for a day or two). But when the lead gets stuck, how do you dislodge it? First, unscrew the tip. Now look inside the removed tip and you'll see that there is a piece of lead in there and you should not be able to see through the lead hole. Then you have to take another mechanical pencil of the same width, get the lead to protrude about a centimeter, and then carefully push that lead into the tip from where it normally writes. Eventually the broken lead will fall out. It's possible to do this cumbersome operation without a second pencil, i.e. with the original, but you have to have more lead in the barrel, pull back on the clinging apparatus, push the barrel as if you're going to push out some lead, now hold it so that some lead will begin to fall out, about a centimeter or so, and then continue as mentioned above. If you don't want to fiddle around with this BS--imagine you're on a bus or in a classroom taking a test or following a fast-talking lecturer and all of a sudden the lead gets stuck like this. Don't waste your time. Spend a few dollars extra and get the original.

title: Adulthood is writing reviews about pencils.
body: THE BEST PENCILS HANDS DOWN! I buy nothing else. I bring my own pens and pencils to work because I am stupidly picky and Pentel are always the best choice for me. These write very nicely, the lead is thick enough to avoid too much breakage but not so thick that you can’t write neatly in small spaces. The twist eraser is my favorite feature, way easier and less annoying than the click ones, and you never end up with a flattened eraser that’s impossible to remove and replace.

title: My favorite pencil
body: I use these every day. They are my favorite pencil. They feel A LITTLE cheap in my hand, but not cheap enough to break, more like cheap enough that I don't have to worry about breaking them which is actually what I like. They write well, and clean.The only drawback is that the return is a little stiff when you try to retract the lead, so you break a lot of lead early on until you get used to that. After you get used to the stiff return, there are really no problems, and overall it is a great product.

title: Best Mechanical Pencils I've Ever Used
body: I've been using mechanical pencils since I could write. I've used them all: BIC, Paper Mate, Pilot, Uni Ball, Zebra, Vivo, and of course Pentel. Most mechanical pencils have at least one of three common issues: (1) the grip is too high on the barrel; (2) the lead jams if you try to put too many pieces in at once; or (3) the eraser doesn't last long enough. These yellow Pentel Twist Erase mechanical pencils have none of the issues I've just discussed. First, the grip is low enough on the barrel that you can actually hold the pencil at the grip and write accurately. Second, you can put at least 10 leads inside the pencil and it doesn't jam. Third, they have an impressively long eraser. I erase compulsively, and I've only been using two of these pencils since I bought them in July (it's a pack of 12), and the erasers are barely any shorter than they were when I took them out of the box.The long and short of it is that these pencils are GREAT. They're also yellow, which makes them even better.

title: Great Pencils
body: I've been using these pencils for more than twenty years. As yet I've found none I like better. They usually "walk away" long before they show any sign of wearing out. I think the fact that they keep "getting borrowed" is the only reason I need to buy new ones at all.

title: Red Lead? Or Red Pencil?
body: overall, I'm a pretty positive guy, and I'm pretty happy with most things. This one was a bit of a disappointment, but will probably work out in the end. It took about a month to receive my "Prime" two-day shipping, because the product was apparently back ordered or something (how does a pencil maker run short on pencils?). I'm a huge fan of the higher end Pentel "Twist Erase" pencils, so I figured one with red lead and an eraser specifically designed for that lead would be the holy grail of erasable red lead in a mechanical pencil. But, the biggest disappointment is that "red pencils" didn't mean red pencils in the traditional sense ... It meant "pencils that are red". My bad. Now I have twelve black-lead pencils that I don't need, and I'm back to searching for good quality mechanical pencils with erasable red lead. Oops.

title: Twist-Erase are the Best
body: My freshman year of college, I got a pack of Pentel Twist Erase mechanical pencils. In my 3 years since then, I've never used anything since that have worked as well. I generally liked pencils (over the mechanical) because they felt sturdier in the hand, and the tips were generally tougher. I tend to write a little hard, so at 0.9mm, it's a much more natural write, for me at least.Previously, I had the original Twist Erase pencils (not EXPRESS) and these feel a little cheaper in construction, but otherwise write just as well. The wider body also feels much more natural.Most importantly, the eraser on Twist-Erase pencils are second to none. They're around 3-4 times larger than the average eraser, and will last you at least a solid 6 months per pencil, if you do a lot of erasing that is. You can also buy erasers independently to feed your pencils. Surprisingly, they aren't cheap either, and sometimes find better deals buying just a new pencil/eraser pair then buying just erasers.

title: Great features, visibility not the best
body: This is a first impression, as I learn more, I'll add info.I chose this calculator because I needed more memories/variables for storing often-used constants for chemistry courses. It gives you the following memory/variables for quick recall/use: A,B,C,D,E,F,X,Y,M, looks like 9 memories. There are also 40 built-in scientific constants which are less easy to retrieve (shift,const then 01, 02, etc.) but might be handy (of course you can save selected ones in the memory/variables for easier access).Visibility is always an issue with calculators, both keypad glare and screen angle. Compared to a very basic TI-30Xa calculator, the Casio screen is less readable because the digits are smaller and much less contrast (blue on bluish screen vs black on white/gray for TI). As with most reflective LCD screens, including the TI, you have to get the light angle just right for maximum viewing. This is a significant problem I find because lighting varies a lot in different places. Under exam pressure, you can't afford to misread, but it can happen too easily with these screens. But the TI is easier to read - however, it is just a one-number at a time display. The Casio shows your whole formula as you type it, so for that feature you pay a price with less clarity. With the Casio, if I get the light angle best for the display, I tend to get glare on the buttons. The TI has the same issue, but the buttons are bigger and bolder and black/white, so more readable.I chose the white model Casio to see if somehow it is clearer. The numeric pad is white on gray buttons, which is pretty, but not as readable as white on black for sure. I may get the black model to see if that is clearer (actually not sure a black model is available for this exact version).My eyesight is not perfect, so this may be a non-issue for you, especially young people. I just find that the number of hours spent calculating and reading small text is a factor, so I'm trying to optimize eye strain to a minimum and evaluate study tools in that context.Otherwise, I think this Casio fx-115ES Plus is packed with a ton of powerful features and is a great value from that standpoint.Update 9/9/2022 - a feature I miss on this calculator is the "change sign" button, which flips the result from positive to negative or vice-versa. You can multiply by -1, but it feels cumbersome. Because this calculator enters whole expressions instead of one-number-per-operation like simple calculators, you may not have as much need for the "change sign" function. For me, it is natural and I often like to see partial results as I go. So if the calculation is for example: 66 / (1 - (grams / molar mass)), it is natural for me to first calculate grams / molar mass (showing me the moles of a substance), then "Change Sign" and add 1, then invert the answer and X 66. So "change sign" and "invert" go hand-in-hand for doing a computation "from the inside out" with minimum parentheses. It is also a useful skill in case you find yourself with a simple calculator on occasion. The Casio has the (-) key, but as yet I haven't found it more useful than the minus key. Maybe someone can explain it, the manual doesn't elaborate.Update: somehow I missed the "Ans" button next to the "=" key. So not a single button push, but the "-" button followed by the "Ans" button will invert the sign of your answer and you can proceed from there. Also, the Ans button is needed for taking a function of your last answer, such as log(), etc. (unlike simpler calculators where log always takes log of last calculation). And "alpha" "Ans" will get you the "pre-answer", the answer before the last answer. So there is a two-memory stack at work for the answers.Update: another real weakness of this calculator is there is no (that I know of) quick way to change from fixed point to scientific notation. This is standard on many very basic scientific calculators. You can go through a cumbersome mode shift with shift keys, selecting precision, yada, but a single dedicated key is what is needed. If you have .00612 and want to quickly see it as 6.12x10^-3 or vice versa -- forget it. I think that is a serious omission, and hopefully there is another brand out there with that useful key for my next calcluator. Too bad.

title: Lot's of Capability for the Cost
body: I've been using this calculator for several years now. I teach chemistry at my local community college, and I always recommend this one for its ease of use and convenient fraction entry capability. You just have to get used to the fact that, when in math mode, if the calculated answer can be expressed as rational number ( an exact number in fraction form) it will first show that number. To get the decimal equivalent, you need only press one key that toggles between the formats. You can spend a lot more money on a scientific calculator, but you don't get that much of a boost for the money in terms of everyday numerical calculations, including integrals. Highly recommended.

title: Excellent calculator!
body: I am forced to use this calculator for my Fundamentals of Engineering exam. I was not thrilled with the idea of using a calculator as I have never seen any professional using one in their daily life (Excel is a thing afterall).But after using it while reviewing, I have to say its really not bad at all! It has so many features and small quality of life improvements over other calculators I’ve used. I still don’t see myself using it for anything else other than the exam, but it really is a great calculator.

title: Consider this before buying a graphing calculator
body: Individual needs will vary; you're the best judge for your situation. But, if you're unsure which calculator to buy for typical math and science courses, go with this one first. Hold off on buying a graphing calculator, like a TI-84 Plus CE, until it's clear that you'll actually use it.Why? -- most courses and exams don't restrict the use of scientific calculators; user-friendly graphing software is available online [desmos, wolframalpha, etc]; and, at it's lowest point, the TI-84 CE Plus is about $100 USD new, whereas this fx-115 ES Plus 2 hovers around $15 new.If you end up needing something like a HP Prime or TI-89 later down the road, you'll have saved $100 by not buying a TI-84. (Though, even at that point, you could argue for learning python or another language to accomplish the same tasks on your pc.)You may struggle to see the screen a bit, but this calculator is a workhorse and has the functionality you'll need for your exams and day to day.

title: History is lost every power cycle - not best choice for engineering.
body: Deal-breaker first: this calculator forgets its entire history every time it is powered off or the mode is changed. The only thing it remembers is the last answer it gave and things you have specifically stored in memory.It automatically turns off after "about 6 minutes" (per the manual) and you cant change this timeout periodPI is a two button sequence between far ends of the keypad.There is also no engineering notation display mode and the ENG button will have to be pressed to convert each answer to engineering notation (I believe this is a "casio thing" and not a gripe particular to this model).The rest of the calculator works awesome and I like that it's a little smaller, lighter, and thinner than the Ti-36XPro.Ultimately though, for just a few dollars more, I cannot recommend this over the Ti-36XPro unless the size difference makes or breaks it for you.

title: Regrettably ungainly in one special use.
body: I needed to replace an old Sci/Eng calculator which I often used for metric conversions. On receiving this Casio fx-115-ESP2 I attempted feet-to-meters & found that I needed to remember a 2-digit code to identify which of 44 conversions (22 * 2-ways) I wanted to execute. Ridiculous. Although these codes are printed on the inside of the sliding cover; they are in a -TINY- font which requires both sharp eyes & bright light to read, after first sliding off the cover. I'd rather reach for my tablet or phone to do the conversion. Given this usability failure I re-boxed & returned it.(Oddly, another selection function on this calc uses paged lists to help select the proper item, but metric conversions don't have this option. Any argument that the id numbers are used in programming sequences is entirely without merit. There is an similar Sharp calculator for which it's manual describes a paged conversions selection option.)

title: Tremendous value for the engineering student
body: This calculator has excellent functionality at a student friendly budget price point. One of the most useful functions for the engineering student is the ability to do calculations with imaginary numbers in both rectangular and polar form. The equation solver is also very helpful, with the ability to compute up to 3 variables. Also, there are a large assortment of constants that come with the calculator. You can also compute first derivatives and definite integrals. It also has a nice assortment of statistical functions: std deviation, cumulative distribution function, etc. Lastly, the inputting of computations is more intuitive compared to most of the Texas Instruments calculators, and at 1/4 the cost. A great educational investment!

title: Remarkably Heat-resistant
body: Shoved the Casio fx-115ES Plus Scientific Calculator along with papers and handful of pens in an oven one day to make kitchen counter appear tidy to visitors. Weeks later, forgetting that such papers, pens, and calculator ever existed, I preheat the oven to 350°. I open the oven door after pre-heat to find the paper singed, the pens soft, but the Casio fx-115ES Plus Scientific Calculator survives, hard to the touch, still able to flawlessly compute trigonometric functions. The photo is taken today, weeks after the ordeal with the pre-heating oven.I do not condone or recommend ever placing a calculator in any oven, ever. But know that if you happen to, the Casio fx-115ES Plus Scientific Calculator may be your best bet.

title: Great wide angle webcam, audio is just ok, +1 for physical privacy guard
body: First of all the picture quality is great on this camera and it's performed well on one Zoom call so far. It's a very wide angle so it gets a lot of the room in the frame too.If you don't like that the wide angle includes a lot of the room in the frame another cool feature of this webcam is the free software from their website which allows you to zoom the camera up on where you want the frame to be along with a bunch of color and exposure options.The microphone is the only downside about this camera I've found so far. In Windows it lists it as a "1 channel 16 bit 16,000 Hz (Tape Recorder Quality)" microphone. When I recorded and played back some audio in the Windows camera app it doesn't sound great either. Kind of like a muffled sound talking through an old telephone. For zoom calls it works though and for now it will keep me from adding another cord for a microphone.I really do appreciate that this camera comes with a physical privacy guard and lights to indicate when the camera is plugged in (red) and active (green). With devices that are always connected to the internet it's better to be safe than sorry and a physical control is something that no one can control over the internet.That being said I'd still like to see a physical switch for the microphone in the future.

title: Nice camera
body: I am using this for gaming purposes. Namely speaking for Discord and Twitch streaming. I received the camera in a small box. Came with a manual, the camera itself that has a USB cord, and the privacy protector. Camera looks very pretty and sleek. The attached USB cord is approximately a little more than 3ft long, which is a good length. The privacy protector has a sticky side where you can stick onto the top of the camera as shown in my pictures. Video quality is a lot better than I expected, so it was a plus! I haven't used the mic yet, but it sounded good during my testing. I will update once I get a few uses out of it.

title: Great for the price
body: This webcam is very nice for the price. Its not as good as the name brand ones that cost much more, but that's sort of the point. I didn't need a bunch of fancy features or perfectly undistorted video - just needed a quality webcam that works well every time I plug it in and fire up a video call. This unit is perfect for the average user and is easily recommend it to others looking for an option at a more affordable price.

title: Reasonably good camera
body: Had no trouble with the setup (Mac) and appears to have an acceptable picture quality although somewhat overly bright.My primary concerns are the poor quality of the lens cover door. It appears to come apart if not handled very delicately and also the positioning of the connection cord on the edge of one side at the back of the camera. This location tends to move the camera around and is not conducive to a steady positioning. As a result, I have had to move the camera from the top of my monitor to my computer stand (with a support to insure the proper angle.

title: High Quality & Great Price
body: I can't believe how high quality this webcam is, especially for such an affordable price. I connected it to the external monitor to my laptop so now I can look at the camera and the screen at the same time. I get a lot of compliments in Zoom meetings for how high quality my video looks compared to everyone else using the built-in webcam on their laptop.

title: Works well
customer_id: First time using a second screen and i don’t think I can ever go back to just one! Buy it!
body: Easy to work with! I wish it had a feature that would allow it to be more firm on my laptop and also came in a sturdy enough box that I could always put in back in when I am not using it. Otherwise it’s cool

title: great budget option for a beginner streamer
body: love the camera. bought this to start streaming on twitch. works well, decent picture, and I can use it for meetings at work as well. mic is not as useful, but I already have a dedicated microphone, so that really isn't much of an issue. feel like it competes well against Logitech or other larger, more expensive brands.

title: Great Webcam for the Price!
body: This webcam was very user-friendly. I bought it for weekly Zoom meetings. It is ready to go out the box. I just changed my camera settings to recognize the webcam and it was up and running. The picture quality is very clear and the lighting is perfect.

title: Works well

title: Good product with nice features
body: Loved the product, looks neat and easy to use. No installation required, no software required, just plug and play. Has a wide angle coverage and fitted my 65inch tv perfectly. Clarity was great, except saw some smoothness issues or focus. Sound quality was great.

title: Works perfectly.
body: Great camera microphone combo. I bought it to use during my piano lessons, and it is exactly what I needed. I tip the camera down so my instructor can see my keyboard, but I can still see my laptop screen for instruction. Sound quality is excellent. Glad I bought it!

title: Great webcame for the price!
body: I plugged this into my laptop, which is 6 years old (has Windows 11 installed) and it was recognized immediately. The picture is crystal clear.I had camera issues early on with Zoom and some video and screen capture software, but I found that you had to make sure you enable Microsoft Store in Settings. I did some other trouble shooting and found that the USB port in which it was plugged was faulty and that was why it wasn't picking up video. I was unable to pick up audio from the microphone in Zoom, but I'm not sure if my computer is the issue since it's old, so I won't say it's the camera for now. I'm buying a new laptop. I'll know soon enough.If I had to give it a con, it would be the mounting. The clip lies low on the screen and partially blocks the task bar on top. But for the money, you can't beat this little camera.

title: It's too wide angle for some uses
body: For my purposes, 1:1 videoconferences, the 110 degree lens is too wide angle. Shows everything in the room, alongside my person. In researching this after the fact, I found that approximately 65 to 78 degrees is best for 1:1. In case it's useful to you. The field of vision on this one is not adjustable. Thus, this is going back. I have now ordered another brand, with a 72.5 degree field of vision.

title: Good for money but has a few flaws
body: The price is right. The picture is fairly crisp. I don’t use the microphone as I have a better one - so no complaints on that. My only issues are (A) the video color is a bit off -everything looks bluer than it actually is. My dark brown chair looks navy. My black jackets look navy. My green shirt looks blue-green. And my face is a bit blue - I don’t actually look blue but I need a ton of makeup to not look slightly sickly. (B) the picture is warped at the corners. There’s a door just in frame and it looks curved. I assure you, it’s a regular straight door but if you’re on a zoom with me you’d think otherwise.

title: Not bad for price!
body: I've had this product for about a year now and it's definitely a perfect start for a first webcam. good quality comes with a privacy flap that's detachable, and it's super easy to set up.

title: Works intermittently
body: I bought this camera a couple months ago because I was tired of having to open my laptop to use a camera (I have a set up with double monitors). I don’t have any complaints about the camera picture quality. It does the job. There has been a few times however when it has stopped working if I’ve used it a lot during the day. For example, it will work for an hour and a zoom meeting but then when I switched to a teams meeting it stops working. Sometimes, unplugging it and re-plugging it works. But not always. For that reason, I would not recommend buying it unless there’s some type of user error but I can’t imagine what I’m doing wrong. Also, given my set up, I would prefer the camera to be more in the middle, as opposed to at the top of the monitor. In hindsight, I would pick a different camera set up so that it would not sit on top of the monitor.

title: Great picture quality. Easy to use
body: I bought this camera for Zoom meetings at home because the camera quality on my laptop was terrible, and I didn’t like having to open my laptop for meetings. This camera was reasonably priced, and it works great! It’s really easy to mount on a monitor, and there is no setup! Plug and go. I liked it so much that I bought another for my office. I highly recommend. I’ve been using it for about eight months with no problems.

title: Causing Zoom App & Slack Huddles to Crash on Macbook Pro (Ventura 13.2.1)
body: I was excited to use this camera, as the picture quality far exceeded the built-in camera on my Macbook Pro (currently on OS Ventura 13.2.1). However, after one Zoom call my Zoom desktop and browser applications started to crash, along with the video on my Slack Huddles. When I can get Zoom to start up, I've also noticed a lag when using the share / stop sharing screen feature. I've tried deleting and reinstalling apps, updating the preferences on my Mac to recognize the camera, scouring the user manual, and even reached out to my work IT team to see if our internal security was blocking access to the camera. Unfortunately, the only solution so far seems to be unplugging and plugging the camera back in multiple times a day, which isn't ideal. I'll likely be returning this camera unless I can find a solution.

title: Great picture for the price - but not under fluorescent lights
body: After seeing some sample videos posted by other reviewers, I purchased this to replace a failing Logitech webcam. I'm very happy with the outstanding sharpness, color and overall picture quality when I use it in my remote office at home. But be forewarned, the webcam does a terrible job under fluorescent lighting. I had an offsite work meeting with several colleagues and the room's fluorescent lights caused rolling bands of interference. Of the eight of us using webcams in the room, the NexiGo was the only one with a fluorescent light issue. I took off a rating star because of this. Otherwise the picture is super sharp.Also, the built in mic is poor. This isn't an issue for me since I always use my Pixel buds, but if you're depending on the NexiGo for audio, you might be disappointed.

title: Quality Picture
body: The Nexigo camera was easy to setup; just plug into a USB slot on your computer. The video and sound quality is very good.

title: Good while it lasted
body: These are shoddily and cheaply built, so if you're OK with buying an easy to use, decent plug and play camera that will last about a year and a half, this is your choice. But like so many things built today, this camera is all about QUANTITY not QUALITY so it won't last long and could go out right in the middle of a class, meeting, or job interview.

title: Great For Asking Price
body: I've had many different Webcams over the years, to date, this is one of the best. ONLY issue is, with the software there is NO way to flip the image. Outside of that a great buy.

title: good webcam
body: I used it every day, it is better than my laptop's camera. Very clear! Happy about the purchase every time I use it.

title: Works great for Zoom meetings
body: I love the lens cover

title: It works and has privacy cover
body: I ordered this because work insists I use video calls. Anyway, I previously had two different cameras on my computer and they were, ahem, budget, not much cheaper than this one. Both of those started giving me all sorts of errors and I couldn't fix them so I figured it was a driver/software issue. It really wasn't, the cameras themselves broke down. I've only had this one a little bit so I was super happy that I just had to plug it in and it worked and that was it.It sits almost comfortably on my monitor, but it doesn't sit snugly on my monitor so the slightest shaking of my desk can create some motion in the camera. Not really an issue for me, but worth noting.It has a privacy cover which I truly enjoy because I get paranoid about the camera still being on.Video quality is alright, I notice mine is better than most people in my zoom meetings so if I had to make a statement, I'd say it's better than standard laptop cameras and/or most cheap cameras people would buy. Auto color adjustment on it is whatever, but that may also be Zoom and Teams and nothing to do with the camera. There is some grain in my camera, but I also use a 1920px monitor so I'm not too shocked because if I really wanted crystal clear photos or videos I highly doubt anything in this price range can do it.All in all, this does what you expect it to, and want it to and comes at a great price. I would buy again.

title: Great for the Home PC
body: Easy installation with great picture quality.

title: Works great, albeit the quirks.
body: This is probably the best, cheaper end webcam I have bought in a long time. The microphone and camera quality are quite nice. Though after installing the software for it, it reacted... less than expected in OBS. The screen tore, it flashed green and red, then stopped working. It also tries to hijack your audio settings from time to time if you apps like discord.The positives however are there. It has a large wide view lens that can cropped in the software, it controls contrast and other features too, and fits snug on the monitor. The little lens cap attachment is a nice plus for you tech minded individuals out there. All in all? Not bad. Plus same day shipping was absolutely correct. Arrived perfectly on time. What more could you ask for in a bargain webcam?

title: Lasted a Year
body: I ordered this March 7, 2022. In the last week it has started freezing at least 1-2x each call and never catches me looking good. I have disconnected and reconnected and it doesn’t help. I have been using the same PC and operating software for the last year.

title: Pivot ball broke.
body: Purchased in January and just tried to adjust the direction and the ball broke off of the housing.

title: Simple plug and play
body: I purchased this because my home setup for my work computer has the laptop closed and on a keyboard tray. The laptop is the only mic and camera I have. I had tried using other brands of mic and or camera through a cheap docking station with no success (connecting to a typical dell latitude corporate laptop) with a thunderbolt connector.This one was true to its word; I didn't have to install or set up anything. I connected it to the USB 3.0 output on my docking station and the audio worked immediately. The camera took me changing in a setting in webex to get it to find this camera (which was there, just not set to default). Teams automatically used the new camera. I can't figure out how to use the camera outside of those two programs, but I don't need to anyway, so that's not a problem for me.The microphone sounds great and people can still hear me clearly when I turn my head from side to side or reach to the desk beside me to use my home PC. As long as my head is pointed in the general direction of the thing and within a few feet of it, all is well.

title: Great camera
body: The camera was plug and play and works just fine

title: I didn’t know what I was missing!
body: To start, this was a simple plug and play product that required zero setup on my HP laptop. The native camera in my computer always turned every shirt in wore, with the exception of white, to purple. Don’t get me wrong, purple is a great color, but I don’t want customers to think I only own white and purple shirts!The NexiGo camera instantly became the default camera and was crystal clear across the three different web meeting platforms I use. Normally, I have a grainy image that makes my bald white head shine through as the dominant feature in an otherwise dark video.For my day job, the computer is provided for me and all of my meetings are for that job only, so I can blame image quality on them as my colleagues are in a similar situation and none of us look good. For my consulting job, it is my personal computer that is used and bad image quality reflects poorly on me as a specialist that they paid to see and hear.I use dual monitors and prefer to work off of the larger monitor that does not have a camera. Well, it does now and I no longer have to look like I’m taking to the side when I use that monitor. I don’t move around a lot to best utilize the capabilities of the autofocus feature, but from where I sat for my first meeting, everything was in perfect focus.Not that I need another one for my day job, but I seriously want to buy another after my initial experience with this one.

title: Clarity of picture

Amazon only covers it for 90 days now I need to go through the manufacturer for a replacement. **Update** - I have to say I changed this from a 1 star to 4 star review after receiving a replacement within 3 days of submitting my warranty claim to the company.

title: ScarfAThon
body: Two washes in & it’s nothing short of a b s o l u t e comfort & joy this Holiday season. Or… SO I thought! Dang, you got me on this one. While yes, it’s true this pretty scarf may be worn year round, is soft at 1st few touches & fringed uniformly; EvenEVENeven with the absolute b e s t possible care, this synthetics-heavy scarf is a no-thanks for me. IF only wearing it a handful of times you probably wouldn’t become terribly disappointed. That is, so long as you are w e l l aware this item is in no possible way ‘natural’. Wrapping up in synthetics, even at an affordable price is still very d i s a p p o I n t i n g in my view, full stop. I believe, that is I well know, we can do better. If pilling doesn’t make you break out welp the upside is just how generous the cut, it is long + wide enough to wrapWRAPwrap around shoulders. Sweetly pink, too.* HINT; When a seller is reluctant to bring f o r w a r d front AND center the materials used in manufacturing, it’s as good as any confession, written OR oral reporting s h o u t i n g and I mean announcing to the world at large: ‘Synthetics’. Because reputable, luxury brands actually careCAREcare whichWHAThuh fibers they choose bring their patrons.On the other hand, if you need a temporary product with no longevity available, if nubby, broken, balled-up fibers {cause of pilling} brings no real bothersome effects for ya, then buy away!Because I need natural fibers against my skin due to some glitchy autoimmune junk, for me it’s a one & done here though. Dang! Live & learn.C r i n g e

title: Best value anywhere and good quality!
body: Do the math per ounce, you will not beat Amazon, especially when they have deals for spending $50 or more.I previous bought the "Name brand" hand sanitizier and it was much more watery than I remember... Amazon's brand is ACTUALLY a bit more like the "gel" you remember from childhood! It is gel-like in your hand but it will obviously slide off if you wait a couple seconds then tilt your hand.The smell is exactly like the other aloe hand sanitizer brands.Price: $18.87 (-20% for spending over $50) so it was 15% $2.51 per bottle.If you include 5% off from the Amazon credit card, it is $14.15 and $2.35 per bottle.It is 12 oz, it takes 3 of them to make one of the name brand "big" bottles which are 36oz. 3 of the smaller Amazon sanitizers would be $7.05.Good luck finding a name brand 36oz bottle of hand sanitizer for $7.05.Amazon wins again.

title: Great sanitizer; great value
body: It definitely pays to buy in bulk. These are large 34-oz containers in a package of 4 that is a little more than a gallon in total. I will use them to refill my 12-oz containers. Should last at least a year in my home if not longer. The scent is minimal and pleasant. I like the aloe; not sure if it really helps with moisturizing but the color is nice. Importantly, there is no sticky residue as with some inexpensive sanitizers. There is 62% ethyl alcohol; the CDC recommends sanitizers that are 60% or higher in alcohol concentration, so this should do the trick. I see no downsides to this product.

title: Beware, people with fragrance sensitivity!
body: I am unclear on how anyone who posted reviews here thought there was no smell. Perhaps Amazon has changed the formula recently? The residual and distinct fragrance smell is very persistent, though admittedly not going to be vivid for people who can tolerate/wear cologne or use Axe body wash and such. I cannot handle these synthetic fragrances. This one is strong enough to almost cover the alcohol smell. I immediately washed my hands 3 times with soap and rinsed like 6 times and could still faintly smell this scent residue Just couldn't get it off. I had to eat finger foods right after and it was pretty disturbing to not be able to get the musky smell off. If I wanted overtly scented sanitizer I wouldn't buy something called "basic." I avoid the flashy colorful hand sanitizers that typically have distinct fragrance for the reason of my sensitivity. Never had a problem with the plain original Purell in the past or even the one from the Dollar Tree. Leaving on a trip this week and will have to stop at store for some, since I of course can't use this. I feel the name basic misrepresents this product. If you have even mild MCS or fragrance allergy don't choose this one.

I got a tip that these smell good, and it's true. Not perfumy, but not stinky. It's also not super runny. it's basically the old fashion germX I remember from childhood but without the hefty price.

title: I thought this smelled awful!
body: It could be just me, because some people's sense of smell is stronger than others (mine is), but this product smelled like soy sauce! Or something like that. Gross. And no, I was not eating anything that had soy sauce in it nor was I anywhere near soy sauce when I tried out this hand sanitizer for the first time! So, since I couldn't stand the smell and can't use this, had to get refund for this sanitizer.But otherwise, it didn't seem to dry out my hands (although it's difficult to assess this aspect of it since I only applied it maybe two times?), and consistency didn't feel sticky or too thick, which were the pros!If they change only the scent to a lemon scent (NOT orange!) I would buy this product in a heartbeat.
